Review_Text: It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

If you're not looking to advance within the company then that is just fine. Management always goes on and on about how everyone is replaceable so just do your job and you won't be noticed or bothered. If you're just trying to make some extra money then this is a good place to work.

Having worked in a few departments at Safeway, I can say that the environment is a steady on where you don’t get stressed out, but there’s also usually enough going on to not be bored. The pay is fair for what you do, and there are a lot of great coworkers and most of the managers are great too. There are also opportunities for job advancement and increased pay. They can however be very limited with their scheduling flexibility, and sometimes ask you to stay late or come in on short notice.

Safeway is a reasonable company to work for, the pay benefits and work environment are par for the course when compared to most big box or grocery store chains in the USA. However just as with most other big corporations you will be reliant on your management being proactive and compassionate people if you have any concerns or individual needs that affect your employment.
It’s an alright job for someone who’s looking for first time job. But don’t expect anything fantastic. Some positions are enjoyable to do, others is not.
Our store had absolutely abysmal store management. Terrible schedule-makers and awful communication. Everyone hated their lives working here and I was glad to be gone when I quit.

Management sucks hours are all over the place I wouldn’t work here actually looking for new work. Only good thing is coworkers that aren’t management  it’s just not for someone that is looking for full time work because they will not give you that very stingy with hours but oh wait but they will bug you a lot on your days off to come in and cover a shift honesty my advice is don’t work at grocery business it sucks!!
Flexible with school schedules. Work part time, get called in at times. Working with customers and other employees all the time. Good for starting to work.

all the staff and clerks were very kind and welcoming and if they werent they were bearable. the problem is with management as well as lack of hour flexibility and attentiveness which is what they promised during the hiring process. lack of understanding or attention was given to me via management and i was trained poorly in my department and then criticized for not being able to progress even though i essentially taught myself how to do everything on my own. i also notice that they are doing this to other workers as well.
Safeway is a good starter job as I did for myself.
This was a great place to work overall. Fellow courtesy clerks were supportive, friendly, and fun. The day went by quickly because it was always really busy.
Good place to work.  I enjoyed it the time I was there. Decent management with flexible hours and fun people to work with.  I loved the customers who came in the store.
Good job for benefits but pay raises don’t happen often been there 4 years and barley got a raise in my 3rd year

They really appreciate it when you go the extra mile and I love it when you work overtime and any complaints are always willing to listen to your problem and willing to back you when you need to be backed

Been with this company for 18 years and it just keeps going down hill! Managers make a couple dollars above minimum wage. The turn over is insane because of the pay and they like to over hire due to the turnover so you won’t get many hours unless you want to cover people calling in sick daily. You don’t get any benefits unless you stick it out for a year. Training hours over the years have been cut down to nothing and labor hours cut as well. Honestly work anywhere else!
Not a bad Job regardless of what others say! My co workers were easy to work with so it made the Job fun to work at ! The store manager was cool & friendly & helpful
I was a courtesy clerk, it was my first job, and it was a good first job. Typical day at work you sweep, clean bathrooms, take out trash, bag groceries, get carts, help customers.

Management has no idea how to manage, and just hang out in the back room or outside smoking. Coworkers are lazy and have no clue how to do their job even when you help/explain to them how to do their job and think your being mean. If you don’t hang out and chit chat with management/coworkers they view you as being mean and try to get you fired.

Work anywhere else!! Horrible management and poor work ethic is rewarded as long as you kiss a**. Signed on as full time employee, 36-40 hours/ week, only scheduled for under 20 every week. I was constantly told that the store was over staffed and got sent home. Why how more people is your over staffed to begin with?? Don't waste your time or energy.

I have worked for Safeway twice. Once in 2016 and again  in 2020. Once as an asst mngr in produce and the second time as a cashier. Both times I enjoyed my time there. It was just bad timing. The first time I had to move out if state. The second time I got a much better paying job and had no choice but to take it.  But I'd go back again one day if they'll let me
I like customer service, but the pay and responsibilities don’t match up. You have to pay union dues even if you don’t want to be apart of the union. The late and early scheduling is hard.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

A typical day as a courtesy clerk would look fine if it weren't for the ridiculous need for us to clock in every time we sweep the store. If anything, having to clock in made it more likely for me to sweep less than more, as the literal clocking in process took more energy overall than the sweep of the store did. I also managed to learn just about nothing while working there.

This job was a slog honestly, but for a first time job, it was alright. I only signed up to be a deli clerk, as in only work the counter. I ended up working fryers as well which I hated. I had early morning shifts or closing shifts, I hated it. What made the job awesome were the people, not the job itself. For those on the East Coast, Safeway is a Publix equivalent.
Days are pretty repetitive but that's what you get when you work in a grocery store. I liked my management but some of the co-workers can be obnoxious because it is a minimum wage job,

The department managers were cool but this job was not satisfying at all. The pay was poor this is a job for someone who’s really young or someone who’s really old. Even working for many years you don’t get a raise and your hours always change one week you barely work hours the next week you work a decent amount
I wouldn’t necessarily recommend the job, but it’s not horrible. The pay isn’t great but the job is simple and most the people that work there are nice.

I only worked there for a couple of weeks due to a death and family responsibilities conflicting with the schedule, I told the manager about my situation and was trying to see if they could change the schedule to make it more flexible or have me come back when the situation would be solved but they seemed mad and just accepted the resignation, making that my last day. Other than that, the people I worked with were pretty cool and chill, and it was hard work but it was somewhat enjoyable.
Will never shop in a Safeway. Horrible treatment of employees. Had 3 different store managers in one calendar year. All treated you the same oppressing rules and guidelines and attitude.
fine place to work when you need a job. experience definitely depends on the location and store you work at. different departments within company to try out.
Lousy work environment, scheming employees. Work itself was ok but the expectation of a  day of work was too much. i recommend finding another employer before settling here...
I love retail, just hate the hours.  Safeway is a great place to start a career in retail.  They have many opportunities to grow within Safeway and will also pay for education.
Work hard, get yelled at, work hard some more. Make sure you like working holidays and terrible hours. You will be paid BELOW minimum wage for the first month.
Not bad for a first job, customers can be annoying sometimes. If you are looking for a reliable job, Safeway is the place to go! I would recommend this job to anyone willing to put in the work.

This was my first job and it’s a great place to start. But you do way more than advertised. A courtesy clerk does the basic things like bag groceries, get carts, and do carry outs. I didn’t know that I would practically be running the store. You can get overwhelmed very quickly with the 10 million tasks they ask you to do in your short shift and management never communicates, so one person will tell you to do one thing and then another will tell you the opposite, this can lead to you getting in trouble or looking bad. Customers are usually elderly people or middle aged women and it’s a 50/50 chance they’ll give you attitude and yell at you or praise you and be kind. The liquor cabinet was a terrible experience and the main reason i quit, too many old men being creepy to an underaged girl. People who shop at Safeway tend to feel entiltled and are usually very lazy people, so they act like you’re some robot programmed to work there with no feelings and demand you do things for you rather than talk to you normally. I will say the employee discount is nice and my coworkers were enjoyable.
The work itself is very easy especially if you're a people person. If the opportunity arises take the chance to work in other departments to see what you like.
Constant nights of stocking with a under staffed group of people. Just make this temporary don't think a career will make out of this. Safeway was dreadful to say the least.

Management was terrible at every level. I had the workload of three people, but was barely paid well enough for one. My coworkers while nice were not to be trusted as sucking up to the boss at every opportunity is the only way to keep your job no matter how good at it (the work) you are.

Don’t recommend. Quit only after a month, manager had unrealistic expectations and just a bad attitude. It was a very toxic and stressful work environment. Barely had any training days before being pushed on my own then ridiculed for not knowing how to do certain things when I was never showed or only showed once.

I enjoyed my time with safeway. It was fun. Being crossed trained made the job interesting. Never a dull moment. Its not always the same. If you have a problem with a rude cutomer or employee they address it immediately. I feel that the hardest part of the job is the rude customers. You still have to be polite and not lose control of your attitude.

There's some great people who work her however communication is terrible. Favoritism and negativity is a huge problem here. There is a sense of never being good enough you're asked to preform one way and then the next week the way you are working is not the right way and that's because the communication of the never ending change happens

A typical work day consisted of bagging groceries, sweeping store, pushing carts, and shelfing maintenance. Our location had 1 hour blocks for each of the 4 tasks listed above. Very stress-free job with tons of customer interaction.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

I was offered the liquor manager position in August of 2019, and took it with no raise. I had to threaten leaving to get a one dollar raise above minimum wage for the position. Which includes being the sole employee responsible for an entire Safeway wine and spirit section. This included stocking product, ordering product, and maintaining displays. Upper level management consistently visits stores and only offers criticisms, many of which are things that are direct result of their decisions. For example, management auto shipped a significant amount of product that could not fit on the shelf to the store, and when the management viewed the store they commented on the level of back stock. very few people ever get 40 hours a week, and it is not guaranteed. To get close to a full time amount of work, an employee must have completely open availability. Schedules are often changed with little notice, and are made weekly, on Sunday to Saturday intervals. It was very common to not know when you work for a coming Sunday until the Thursday before. extremely high turn over rate, which leads to easy promotion, often with little to no training. I received a 30 minute unscripted walk through with the director as my training for the manager position. never received any praise for my work, despite always beating previous years sales, and projections.

They want you to make a career out of having no life. Work you six days a week.  Fire older employees.    Cut your time.  No set schedule.    Constantly renegotiate union contracts to take away your benefits.
Driving and delivering groceries for Safeway is very enjoyable. This is a Union job with great benefits. The pay could be better but we get lot's if overtime.
I initially worked as a cashier, when management found out that I have accounting
Just started working here got it's pros and cons like any other job. Have to pay for a union fee since Safeway works for the union. Wanted to see the other reviews
This is a minimum wage job. This is a consistent job with room for advancement if that’s what you want, but most people that work there really dislike it.

fine for short term, they value too much on seniority not whos better at the job. if you want to spend your whole life for a job this one's for you, they have very good benefits for long term workers .

The management did not seem to care to hear employees suggestions. Very few benefits and did not feel valued by Safeway management. Company only seemed to care about what was best for them and not for the employees. Seldom got to take breaks.
Honestly, this was the most warm & inviting retail company I ever worked for. I felt like the job really nurtured your abilities to help you grow & be the best person & worker you could be.

Pay could be better but overall I like my job, you don’t really have to deal with customers 80 percent of the time. You get to move around all day as opposed to standing in the cashier section. Join the union and you’ll have job security so no worries of being fired which I like. Job is definitely not flexible though, they will often forget your responsibilities as a student but if you talk to your managers they will make accommodations. Hours really vary if you are not in stocking Or produce. Moving up will probably take a bit of time but the people around are extremely friendly. Everyone gets to know everyone. Of course there are some fake people in the bunch just be careful who you trust.

The store I worked at. Expected the moon and more from us. Management was on us constantly with about things out of our control. New people were often compared to multi year veterans in the deli department as if they should be able to work at the same place despite being here for under a month.

Safeway is a great place to work.  I had plenty to do to keep you busy.  And one thing about the job is that it can keep me busy . Its just the management sucks . I've had 3 managers the time I was there.

People you work with can be lots of fun, but if you aren't part of the union, management tries to screw you over. Hard to switch departments within the store and some of the customers can be super annoying to deal with. Pretty meh.

The duties of a Courtesy Clerk is basic house chores, some co workers are helpful and can work as a team, but there were those who weren't. Management always took the side of the checkers or other Courtesy Clerks when something bad happened. I liked working the swing shift because I was able to get more stuff done.
Everyone at my store seems like they don’t care  about their job and there are a lot of slackers, you usually see a lot of people doing nothing, and there’s little if any hours to go around

The people itself were great. Hardly no problems with coworkers. Sure, a majority were lethargic. Hours were decent, but you didn’t have a full time job unless you advanced your career. Advancement rarely took place. Pay raise was not by much. You work at a grocery store; expect customers to be unruly sometimes. Management was absolutely terrible. Barely have hours, and didn’t do anything if you had problems with coworkers constantly calling out and calling you in. You work for a union. Expect everyone to be protected, even those who shouldn’t work.
Fun place to work just poor management, safety cookout for lunch once in a while, coworkers very helpful and positive attitude, safety's big there and organized

The store manager as well as the Deli and Bakery are terribly managed. The store manager doesn't listen to his employees, doesnt know how to utilize his employees strengths and weaknesses. Scheduling is irratic and unpredictable. Staff is generally morose,  highly underpaid and underappreciated.

I was not properly trained to be a cashier. And then they made me a lead in their new Drive Up and Go dept (online grocery pick-up). That dept was understaffed and I didn't get enough help when it was busy. Hard to get lunches and breaks covered too. Then they cut my hours to part-time and I had to look for another job.

Big company, over 2200 stores total.  Good and bad, you will get the big-time experience you are looking for but at a cost.  Salary is lower than scale for IT positions and advancement opportunities are limited.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

The company treated me fairly, and I enjoyed my time there. There were some managers and employees who were awful, but most of them either left or were fired. They were flexible with my time, and paid me well. Hardest part was that we were often understaffed, and that it got really slow at times. But the being in the work environment was fun and comfortable, and we all had a good sense of comradery.

My Supervisor continually embarrassed employees and talked down to them in front of co-workers (Union representatives said they could do nothing since the union represented both of us. Management ignored situation, and told me to go to Human Resources. Human Resources did nothing to help the situation. On the other hand the other supervisors were great. No raise after 2 years of employment.

As the review summary suggested, grocery stores can be busy sometimes, and when it gets really busy, things can get hectic. Since it's a grocery store, people come and people go. This is true for both employees and customers. Your work experience will largely be dependent on the area you live in.
Very poor training and support. The weekly schedules are put out only 5 days in advance. Vacations not approved in a timely manner. Impossible to get a consistent schedule.
My work experience is good I have been at Safeway six years and I feel its a decent place to work. I think it's a good place to make a career out of.

Poor management and poor training along with not enough pay for the amount of responsibilities management tries to get you to do. They often hire only part time and then work way over full time hours with no benefits. No overtime pay, holiday pay. They also believe money and the business is more important than family or religious views.
The new COO seems to be embracing a more healthy corporate engagement. Pandemic bonuses, longevity bonuses, better access to behavioral health through insurance.
It was all good biggest thing was the customers just time them out you know no favoritism that I seen I don’t know how as just thier to  and go home b

I like it. Get up early and prepare fruit. Getting up early can be gard but you get used to it and meet new people. Zero customer interaction which is good. Still have rest of afternoon off after working the typical 8 hour shift.

It's like being thrown into a cage of snakes and trying to focus on your task. Not to mention they always call and interrupt home life... Just overall a place for people who don't cate about themselves.
Was delivery driver. Pretty much basic arrived at store get your truck keys, manifest  and route phone load up your totes with groceries inside and delivered groceries. Scheduled days and nights.

Not too bad, easy going for the most part. It's a grocery store so it's not too complicated. Can get a little busy and short handed but you get some job security being with the union. Easy to request days off and call in when needed.
Quite good for start,  but not much advancement for diligent employees, pay is rather good, but no on the job training, bonuses are quite good too soMETIMES
I started during the pandemic when I lost my

Constantly changing with seasonal and holidays. Never a dull moment. Make sure and hire the best candidates to fill supervisor roles and take the time to invest with the associates in order to make a difference.
Management has a few good ones but overall lacking. Big businesses is always about the bottom line. Co workers are great. Hourly rate could be more for the amount of work to be done.

Safeway was a fun place to work part-time only!!! Was able to take off when I needed to and was able to pick up hours easily! Coworkers gossip which brings a lot of drama! Management was cool and fair! Pay was ok but needs to be increaesd
This is a great company to work for but they were bought by Albertsons since I worked for them. I also worked in a union when I worked for this company. This is why I had great benefits and pay.

This is a standard retail job, which means the pay won't be great and you won't feel like you're going anywhere after the first year. Stress is moderate to high, depending on customer volume. My biggest complaint is that the company has chosen the strategy of having mostly part time employees so that they can avoid giving out full-time benefits, which leads to a high turnover rate and employees who aren't very good at their jobs. If the position you've applied for says full time, don't trust it. Safeway is a decent place to work if you're still in school or live with other people who are drawing an income. If you don't fit that description, look for other opportunities.

Corporate cares about their bottom line and nothing else. You are a money-maker, not a human, and are given the stink-eye for taking breaks, drinking water in the departments is not allowed (but of course you can't take a break to drink it either), overtime is frowned upon, but they expect you to get the same amount of work done as you do when you work 10 hours. Just don't do it to yourself.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
It has been 5 years since I quit this job. But I still remember it as being a productive place to work in. The pay wasn't all that great. In fact the pay was way too little
when comparing to other retail jobs, it's actually quite cushy. but retail in general is becoming more and more unbearable with COVID shots etc so I'd go somewhere else if given the opportunity.
Loved this place I worked for so many years and continue my loyal service with them.. I completely agree with a lot of different situations that would help me grow within this company..
Life is what I make it really bathtubs location do your work and go home schedule was well balanced life wrangle oretttg fair bit if cigdrse favored was the key get
My time  at Safeway was ok but then then got really petty to all the full timers  all the write up for little  things like a minute  late an calling in

Working as a cashier here makes me feel important and needed on the team. Management are always available to help. The customers can be a bit rude or nasty sometimes but there's always a nice one right after to make it better.
Starbucks is not stressful at all under good management.  The pay is very low though and once you are capped ,you get no more raises which suck. Not alot of advancement opportunities
If your close to the managers then you have easier time of moving up. Huge turn over with employees that leave because they though work was going to be easy
They only wanted to give me 16 hours a week. At minimum wage this is definitely not liveable or kind. No training. Rude customers. Forced lunch breaks even on a short shift.
Will work with you easily involving any scheduling changes that you may need. Good management team in place, great teamwork structure amoungst employee's
It got good people but it's not a fun place to work. I love to work somewhere else. The work is hard but the paid isn't that great that can motivate people to stay there
Easy, typical grocery's job, good training, but some seasoned coworkers can be critical. Tough to move up. Overall it's a low stress job and good for student. I loved being part of the union.
Depending on the store you work in you'll either have really good management or horrible management but wherever you are be prepared to work your butt off.
Compared to chains, grocery pharmacy's a walk in the park. Having said that, often times it becomes too bland. Ok for those who like that kind of pace
I love working at Safeway The company is great has great benefits. They work with your availability and there is always room for learning new things.

I was haired on spot. No training whatsoever I was thrown into working automatically. I was expected to do so many things I didn’t know at all. Id ask how to do certain things or ask for help and just get attitude or get ignored :/
Highly recommend NOT working for this company. Lacking everything important needed for a strong , healthy environment. Pay is not equal to amount of work you will put in.

Overall, the management seeks to improve their productivity and their bonuses by fudging the numbers about people working over time and threats if you are trying to complete a task that requires your full attention. They believe that you should clock out before you aquire any overtime and then return to your area if responsibility to give a good turnover to the oncoming shift about the project you were working on to be finished by the oncoming shift. Giving turnover is considered WORK!!  WHO CARES IF YOU HAVE TO STAY ON THE CLOCK A FEW MINUTES TO GIVE TURNOVER TO A SHIFT THAT CAN'T CLOCK IN EARLY.

This job is busy. You spend a lot of time walking around the store while sweeping, facing shelves, returning groceries, and collecting carts. Sometimes the close shifts can been stressful because there are so many responsibilities, but the other courtesy clerks are helpful and most of the managers are reasonable about expectations on a busy night. Much of what you do as a courtesy clerk is repetitive, but it's good exercise.
Director and assistant don’t address any issues brought to them. There are a lot of favoritism there. No team work. Everyone on their own. No communication on what’s going on.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Some people work, others don't and those that do, do more. Some are late 90% of their shifts, leaving the work for those who show up on time. Some call of once every week or every other week, and those who are there pick up the slack. Do you get paid for doing the work of the slackers, call offs and late arrivals? Of course not.

Generally do not get two days off in a row but work 5 days a week for 16-20 hours a week,Have open availability and still mostly do not get more than 20 hours a week. One day you come in at 6: am the next day your scheduled at 6:00 pm or an overnight shift. No reason to do that to melters.

This job is great for people who just need a job to pass time, or to build up your resume very slightly. Upper management is terrible with hours constantly changing and empty promises left and right. I would not recommend moving up into management, they will tell you about a raise and never give it to you. And if you need a full time job with consistent hours forget it, they will work you 40 regardless if you want to or not and then drop you to 20 the next week regardless if thats what you want or not.

Decided to work here as an in between job right out of highschool. been here 5 years. Its not a horrible place to work. You get to meet a lot of people. I only recommend long term at this company if you plan to move up!

I worked as a courtesy clerk for about half a year and in that little time many other courtesy clerks quit and then I finally quit myself because I finally understood why. The job itself as a courtesy clerk just sucks, you have to do all the dirty work no one wants to do such as moving carts in bad weather which was very exhausting and uncomfortable, you also have to clean the public bathrooms which was always disgusting and you just have to clean up any mess in the store that's made. I was hurt many times while working there and now I have ongoing wrist problems.You also get treated badly by customers and management.The management was lazy and bias and not understanding at all. If you're young, management will definitely take advantage of you and assign you bad shifts, they would make me move carts for three hours straight in the rain while others weren't assigned to do carts at all that day. Some coworkers are nice but there were some that made me uncomfortable. I also wasn't getting very many hours, I was getting about 8 hours a week and the little pay I was getting was just not worth dealing with what I had to. You have to deal with rude customers, management, coworkers, and gross cleanups. Only work here if you don't have to be a courtesy clerk.
This was during covid and was not bad. Drive up and go was my favorite part because it was independent l. Overall a solid job. My coworkers were great as well
Work there for eight years, it was cool in the beginning as a first job. But than management changed over and it really sucked. Only plus is the benefits.
If you just love to put your head down and do the job given. This is the job for you. The harder you work, the more work they give you.

This job is an utter nightmare. When I started working there in October I was given a pretty simple schedule probably 16-20 hours a week. When I started to work there for longer they started to schedule me for 16-20 hours just over the weekend and not spread out along the week. This often changes between shifts but it is normal to work 8 hour shifts on each weekend day. The management is poor, to the extent of which you get written up or docked for talking to coworkers, but the managers who write you up are also talking and completely distracted most of the time. Also DO NOT WORK HERE IF YOU ARE UNDER 18. The managers are completely ageist and they believe that if you are a minor you should do their work for them on top of your duties. Also you make minimum wage as a minor which I didn’t know because they never told me how to access my paychecks until I had to ask on my 3rd or 4th day. I think that they choose not to tel minors what the pay is in order for them to secure the job. Also you have to join the UFCW 7 (The local Union) as a minor. Which takes $15 a week out of your paycheck. So technically you aren’t even making minimum wage you are making closer to 10-11 dollars an hour. Also more recently they hired to many Courtesy Clerks and everyone has 6-12 hours a week. They also have no warning to any of us about the recent hourly cut. Overall I would never work here again, I would never recommend this job to anyone. I hope I can find another job so I can be done with this one.
It was a great overall experience  just my manager was micromanging and hard to work with. As a whole it was great learning experience. Learned alot about produce and customer service.
I worked at Safeway for 8 years give it take and I personally loved it the only reason of my leaving was my pay was horrible other then that it was a great place.
Safeway is probably the worst place i've ever worked, i've been here a year and i see nothing but rotating doors for all my fellow bottom of ladder hourly workers. it's disgusting.

The managers do not care at all about the employees. They do not respect your time and are not willing to let you go home sick, even in a pandemic. They also do not enforce their own mask rules leading to customers putting the employees at risk. They won't train you either, you'll get thrown into full shifts a few days after you start with basically 0 guidance and will get reprimanded or mocked by your coworkers for not knowing instinctively what to do.
The work is the same every night and if you're not friends with management then forget about getting treated like they care about you. Co-workers are fun to be around.
Very understaffed. Allowing me to take on the whole deli department most of the time. Would be a good job If there was more staff and nicer coworkers
Traditional corporate company with basic benefits. No really outstanding extra perks, and your work environment is dependent on the department you are in.
I worked as a cashier and it was ok, I only worked part time and it was ok. People can be stressful exspecially when it gets busy, like football sunday or holidays.
Typical workday with Fun. Managment is transpraent , flexible work hours. Most enjoyable part is the team which helps to maintain fun and enthusiasm. overall the best
I loved my job there as a cashier. I fell into trouble when I switched to night crew. There was poor management on night shift. If I was able to work there again I would definitely do that.

This is a good place to work if you’re going to work in retail pharmacy. Other places I have worked are far busier and more stressful. I worked with great pharmacists and felt a strong sense of patient care here. The only cons are the pay and benefits.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Safeway es una buena compañía para trabajar porque tiene buenos beneficios de salud y retiro,pero el ambiente laboral,es estresante,y había mucho hostigamiento de parte de mis Managers o jefes ,tampoco te promueven luego  luego,a mi me discriminaron,mucho y costó que me promovieran en general esta compañía te ofrece beneficios de seguro médico,y de pensión,no tienes un horario flexible.

They expect you to work to the point of sheer exhaustion yet never make you feel valued for all you give them. I was a well known highly demanded employee with Safeway and wish I never walked in the door. Shame on them.
I have worked for this company for almost 30 years. The culture has become more toxic with the high employee turnover and the bottom line being the priority.
This job was a good job to work at, during the peak of the virus, they raised the hourly pay. There is always something to do to keep you busy to do while there.

GroceryWorksDotCom should really take the time to train their employees better and accurately, instead of standing/sitting around the work space, acting like they know what they're doing, when all they do is just take long extended breaks, talk negative about other grocery workers and leave the work place a mess, having other grocery workers clean up after their mess. They make the delivery drivers wait for a long period to load up their assigned routes in the delivery trucks, leaving the chilled and frozen products, including all raw meats sit outside of the chill box and freezer for more than 10 minutes, after DotCom Shoppers have completed picking the items for delivery. There is no support from management, and requested hours to work for overtime are not approved. I wouldn't suggest nor would I recommend working at Safeway.
It’s not a bad place to work. Management takes care of issues that arise. You have the opportunity to move up in the company if you voice this is something you are Interested in.

Don't respect employees at all they out just for the mighty dollar no matter what it takes. They will work no matter what, don't care if you as an employee has a life or anything important in your life you NEED to be there no matter what.
Great starting pay. Great team. Manager work with you on your schedule . Only hard part is you don’t get recognized for hard work very often and get asked a lot of you.
It’s easy work sometimes. But when it gets busy they expect you to do everything. They used to work me 10 hour shifts with no breaks. No 10s or 30s at all.
They treated the new and young like they need to do lots when they didn't even learn or just started. Having them do new tasks that doesn't fir the job description

I was constantly yelled at by customers and management would always suck up to them and give out gift cards like candy. Once, I was forced to bring lobster tails to sell at the gas station (in the summer!) by the seafood manager, and the store assistant manager told me to get out when I questioned the safety of that. The seafood manager yelled at me and practically pushed me out of the store to go back to the gas station. The next day, the store manager just treated the whole thing as an 'oopsies' and laughed it off.

You don’t get paid well, also they hire people to void spots instead of make you good at your job. If you love being employed by a office who works your life away you found it. Been here for a year and I’m over it.

I've learned a lot about this company over the 3+ years I have worked here. I try to conduct myself honestly and with self-respect regardless, but when I first started here I was definitely naive. I would give 100% no exception. I would fix things other people did (or didn't do...) because I wanted my department to operate smoothly and efficiently. One night I even stayed until 2am because the guy came to turn off the freezer so they could clean it the next day. No one had told us of course, but if I didn't move the frozen food into the back, we would have lost thousands in product. I've also done research, and read product manuals on personal time to correct how we were using/cleaning certain appliances.

Just started an the manager that interviewed me didn't even know my wage id be making also im supposed to be full time witch typically includes benefits well I have yet to get the paperwork from them aswell as when I try too talk to them about these things they are either too busy or not in when I'm getting off my over night shift an to be honest after a long night of grave shift getting off at 830 in the morning all im thinking about is sleep not sitting around waiting to talk to my management but get paid weekly an a job is a job.
if you are a new hire and don't need a good wage or benefits this is a good fit, you only get full time if you are in management, otherwise 24 hours a week, write ups for overtime

I started during the pandemic, worked through the busy holiday. Started out fine. Then realized how much the other departments hated dotcom. Other departments are quick to speak badly about you without coming to you first. DM and store managers are not supportive. At least you can pick your shift. Very physical work. Walk minimum 5 miles a shift.
It is a very good first job. I strongly recommend if you are trying to get the first job Safeway or a local retain shop would be considered as an "OK" job. I loved it.
flexible with schedule and good hours. Part-time employees also get benefits which was a great plus. Pretty easy job to keep up with, you do the same thing everyday
If you’re young this is the job for you. Everything is pretty good and the pay is fair depending on what your job title is.

I enjoyed working here because of who I worked with. The company itself was full of rules and regulations. I worked here for eight months and I saw that HR would fire people with little reason. It's a good job if you're looking to get into management. They're always understaffed.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Working as an online shopper was an interesting experience; you're constantly moving from one section to another pretty quickly, its most likely the best position to familiarize yourself with the store. Be ready to run into dazed and oblivious customers though. Cool and friendly coworkers who really assist in the process of learning the site. Until you reach the manager, constantly being unprofessional, wearing literal HEADPHONES on the site with no care for one's image unless in front of higher-ups. Pay is too little to be consistently moving from one side of the site to the other for over 8 hours with slim breaks. Not to mention, inconsistent scheduling causes major pile-over to people on shifts. My first two weeks in, I ran over 12hour shifts over 4 DAYS. For a veteran worker, this may sound simple but I was only 2 weeks old. I was forced to take on responsibilities I was never even shown to yet. It showed me how unorganized the scheduling really was. Soured my image for the site and its employers, Id rather much stay as a customer

You are just a number to them. U give and give they JUST TAKE. Don’t care about people. After 38 years of service because one new assistant manager doesn’t like you you’re fired. 37 years in the snow never missed a snowstorm except for when I was on maternity leave. I was extremely dedicated. You had to do everything in the whole store except for the big

My department manager was amazing both as a boss and friend, and is someone who I still talk to. Loved working for her. Because of that, I had some great times at Safeway. But corporate is absolutely awful, they are rude to even their most productive and hardworking people, and don't care about their employees. They'll always be looking for a reason to fire you, and if the union can't protect you they will, over the smallest things too. Plus depending on where you work in the store, the work itself is not very enjoyable. Do not work in the deli! Deli is awful and you work so so much harder than the other departments. If you can, get a job in bakery or produce.

Has newer trucks, offload with electric pallet jacks (so manual labor is minimal), most stores have hydraulic dock plates. Management is usually on the driver's side so conflict with stores are minimal
Small town atmosphere, Customers are very classy and happy. Can't please everyone but we give it our best. The best is when customers come in mad and they leave happy.

When I was in the pharmacy I was told Safeway would help me become a pharmacy technician. With a pharmacist behind me because of the way I worked I inquired about getting certified the manager at the time said they can not do it at this time. A week later we where told that if we where not certified we would have to leave the pharmacy and they hired two people off the street instead of letting me continue to work and get certified.

It was a fun place to work because of the employees and customers but the management needs some serious work. Lazy, rude, and simply don’t care about how to improve things. The store is always understaffed so they are always overworking you. I would get called called in so often but when you would try to request any time off it was always denied.
It was a great place to work however, some of the management were hard to work with. Has great pay because it is a union job which offered some job protection.

I worked inside as a barista and it was the worst barista job i've ever had. low pay, low tips, and people were spending all of their EBT money on expensive Starbucks drinks, meaning my tax dollars were going right back into the corporation in which treated me so poorly. Management was unresponsive to requests for more hours or to move departments and my typically work week was a 20 hour week working 5 days a week on short shifts.
Cool people to share shifts with. Covid-19 made things challenging. So much hand sanitizer. People are respectful of your break time. Garage gets smelly in the summer.
Management not fair. High perfoming stores pushed to do more while failing stores not held accountable. Always expected to do more with less  retail but not as bad as cvs or walgreens
One of my first jobs as a teenager and it was as cashier. I have never disliked something more. The pay was minimum and despite having told them my availability they kept for longer shifts.
Very easy job. In charge of organizing store, cleaning bathrooms, and putting away carts. Management and employees are very kind and helpful. I recommend this job.

They will have you work in every department possible with little to no training. The employees do not enforce the mask mandate and often break it themselves. When a careless coworker gave me Covid-19, they wanted me to come back in before my doctor cleared me. They also don't care about your time, they will have you close one day (at 11pm) and open the next (starting at 5am). This, and so much more, is exactly why they have such a high turnover rate. Save yourself! Find a different job!
Great staff and great savings. Not enough hours for store and poor management Communication between supervisors is not well. Could be more I formed my f things.
Isn't as bad as cvs but not as good as costco. There are metrics and DPMs can still be breathing down your neck about goals. Can be chronically understaffed but what pharmacy isn't?

A lot of inconsistencies some work weeks you will have 30 hours of work, next week it could be 16 hours. Depending what department you work in the managers are nice and will try to help you succeed and help you with time off when you need it. Overall just have to make it work for you until you find something else. I wouldn’t stay long.
They are a good company to work for. I would not have left if I did not move. Coworkers are nice & management is helpful. I felt at home & like I mattered.
It's a good job but it is alot of hard labor with mainly one day off so it can be tough on the body other than that it's a union job with great pay an benefits

management could not care less about the employees safety and health.       Do not give you a consistent work schedule. They stopped limiting the amount of people in the store which is ridiculous because covid is still a thing and the store gets really really packed and then customers get angry and take it out on the checker's and courtesy's. coworkers and managers talk bad about you when you call in or are out on covid leave. Management posts a list of the checkers  name and employee ID numbers with a GS1 score to shame them for not getting above 95%.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Safeway is a great job for anyone who wants too work in a place where they can feel really involved in their community. Great management and schedule flexibility are a couple of the things that make this job worth checking out.
Was a great first job taught me alot about working with money and people also working in very fast past enviormemt when we were busy really helped with customre satisfaction
good reliable profession , very physical work. must be able to stand for long periods of time, you will appreciate each and every beak to get off your feet
This was a perfect job for a teenager who was busy with school work and other activiites.  The company provides decent training and uniforms when you're starting.
Management DOES NOT SUPPORT THEIR DRIVERS,  It's their way or the highway,  many many dissatisfied drivers for safeway.   Very POOR MANAGEMENT IN THE TRUCKING WAREHOUSE OFFICE.
low pay, not a good place to work. This company needs to pay their workers a living wage, it is just disgraceful what Safeway pays their employees.
This place is like working in the twilight zone! They only give the good hours to their favorite employees! Full of drama! My manager at Starbucks was stealing my tips.
but it was an experience so not all negative...will continue to say positive things just too much favoritism and not based on work ethic or work productivity

i worked for the .com grocery delivery department. it was a very enjoyable physical outgoing position i enjoyed it very much.  i learned a lot on my 10 years plus in this position.  i thought to myself this is it; i have a secure enjoyable job where i know it will last forever.  not the case!  management abruptly decided in shutting down this department the last day of february.  a poor, unwise, very dumb decision.  leaving thousands of employees without a job.  sure it was easy for management to say "we will place you inside the company but with lesser salary".  easier said than done! i am discouraged and outraged about this foolish decision from corparate.  they never did give me a legible logical explanation as to why they suddenly shut down the .com delivery department.
Poor compensation and poorly managed. Not a place you want to work long-term. That's probably why the turn-over is so high. It can be stressful at times.

If you want your license to be in jeopardy it’s a good place to work.  The amount of prescriptions done vs the amount of staff your allowed to schedule, leaves you with about 3 minutes per prescription.

I recently started working as a bakery clerk at my store. So far I'm enjoying my job and getting to know my everyone in my new department(I've worked in 3 other departments in the past 2 years). I used to work in the Jamba Juice kiosk at my store but it recently closed so I had at switch departments. Luckily all the upper management at my store is very supportive and allowed me and my coworkers to choose what department we wanted to work in. As long as you work at a store with management that's supportive(and recognize hard work), work hard for the money you make, and make friends with your coworkers, working at Safeway actually isn't all that bad.
My first job at 16 and the worst one I ever had. They will work you to the bone on shift, even the minors, for barely above minimum wage. The managers and CEO do not care about you at all.

I worked in the evening. It took a lot of time to clean up and some of the other employees wouldn't pull their weight so it fell on the rest of us to clean up everything. Management was no help with the situation.

I learned some great skills at safeway, baking, customer service, how to work with a team, I just got bored. Overall its a pretty decent job I just need something a little less monotonous. If you're looking for a predictable job with the possibility of overtime then this might be a good fit for you.
Management was clingy to each other and never listened to other sides of opinions and incidents. They were also rude to customers and made working there a total pain.

Safeway is a okay first job. But I wouldn’t recommend working here long term. I am not a fan of the lack of communication. Employees get away with things other employees don’t get away with. If you have certain days you’re available to work. They possibly can schedule for the days you can’t work. I hate that you don’t get a constant schedule. Every week you’re scheduled will be all over the place. Some of the people I work with are okay people. I hate that there are some made up rules that you don’t even know if they are true or not. They didn’t give me a employee hand book like they’re supposed to. It would be helpful to know what’s okay to wear and all the rules with being a employee there.
It's a good place to work at. Great benefits only cons would be you only get a half hour lunch break. If you show up and do your job there's opportunity for raises and advancement.

Safeway is a great place to start out at. Or if one is on the later end of one's working career it's a great place to get benefits. Safeway values a good work ethic but moving up as a career isn't possible unless one is willing to cow-tow to the politics, upper management, and location moves to progress.  Grocers use to be a valued, well paid and respected careers but the Corporations have taken that from the average guy with low pay and lack of support to hardworking employees.

The HMB safeway is the only regular grocery store that’s close enough so that you don’t have to go over the hill, so it was extremely busy all the time. The bosses were okay, coworkers were great. Pretty standard minimum wage job.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

This job was a good job to work at, during the peak of the virus, they raised the hourly pay. There is always something to do to keep you busy. The one thing that irritated me the most was pushing carts in the heat. Loved one of the managers there though, the rest, not as much.

its not a bad place to work, but with the decently low pay and having to pay union dews, a-lot of my paychecks aren’t what they should be as well in order to have benefits and get better pay you need to be there for a while, therefore someone who really cares about their education they are 50/50 with school flexibility and things that come up that are out of your control to where you cant work that day.

I worked with some fun people and they worked around my schedule well but management is terrible and don't care to help you grow and succeed. The also hire the laziest employees who show up or no call no show. They don't fire them and have no consequences for them.

I don’t recommend working here for anyone. Management is awful, they do not care about the workers at all, so expect to be mistreated and miserable if you work here. The schedules are never posted on time (and paychecks are also almost always late..) making it hard to even live off the poor salary. Worked for almost 4 years and never got any recognition, raise, and they denied me time off.

I was lead cake decorator for our store and never felt appreciated for the work done. Between filling the cake case, making back up, creating cake orders, filling cream island and freezers and ad tables... It was never enough. And God forbid you have an empty spot come the afternoon. They took hours away yet required the same or more than before. It's never enough. The manager belittles people and makes of the employees. Its a toxic environment. In order to succeed you need to be a yes man. Don't ever speak up about the things that are wrong. This job is physically, mentally and emotionally taxing unfortunately.

I worked at the Green Mountain location and unfortunately as wonderful as the workers are the building itself is falling apart and corporate doesn't give us any hours. Also the pay is so slim can't survive on it.

Working at the bakery in Safeway was relatively relaxed. Occasional reconstructions of the department were done throughout the year which were somewhat stressful. Infrequent interaction with the manager and lack of timely communication with coworkers led to me sending in my resignation.

Was a good job, with amazing benefits and regular raises as long as you worked your hours. However it is still all customer service based and that can always be a con. As long as you work hard  and have patience with people you will reap the rewards.

I have been trying for 5 years to get a raise and have always worked every single holiday including Christmas Day New Year's Day, Thanksgiving. Easter Memorial Day Weekend.  I sometimes get a $5 Thank You card but lately, the management refuses to reward anyone for doing a good job.  We have been cutting hours in our store in anticipation of a new competitor in the neighborhood.  Therefore on many occasions, I have to budget myself on a week-to-week basis and even have to go without meals. We have a defined contribution 401 K plan but there is no employer match.  There is never a chance to get promoted from part-time status to full-time employment and it is really sad that the part-time employees are the most dedicated and hard worrking but never are given even a chance to apply for full time work.

Pretty typical union retail environment, like I said in the title. Coworkers are helpful and have a good sense of humor. Work environment can be tiring with so much walking. Job security and advancement is decent, you can level up your wages quite a bit if you stay for a while.

This job is stressful and so dirty and there’s large amounts of covid cases here and everyone has a whatever attitude and it feels like a prison here. Apply somewhere else as the pay may seem good but your own health it’s not!!!
Great gym,
If you want to be spied on by ur fellow employees work at Safeway. King rd. store is the store I worked at. Never again!!!
I really liked working at Safeway.  I advanced very quickly. Everyone there was friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend Safeway as a job opportunity.
Work is very steady. During this pandemic we stayed open. They reduced the store hours and used precautions such as sanitizer and wipes. Would like to have many more hours though.

Do not apply at this company unless you like getting treated like your yesterdays garbage ( Just Kidding) the managers there treat you like your not important at the company the best part was working with the co workers

Safeway was my first job when I moved to Oregon. I worked as a Starbucks Barista inside the safeway and I hated going to work everyday. No one cares and managment seem to hate their job. No one is happy. I worked there for 5 months and quit when I found a better place. The pay sucks and the union is so annoying and are pretty much useless.

No work/life balance. They gave you a hard time if you were injured on the job. I was employed there for 25 yrs and was laid off, along with 500 other employees when they decided to close the distribution center. They did not provide resources for employees to seek employment elsewhere like they told the media they would. It was difficult to be promoted. The pay was not fair
Negative energy in the work environment. No structure for advancement the negative environment makes for long miserable night shift Overall bad place to work
I enjoyed working with my coworkers.  Customers were great for the most part.  Typical of retail,  there were some customers who made the job more stressful than normal.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
Management has favorites and doesn't listen to employees. Doesn't accommodate for those that have light duty.  Also the management doesn't care about employees
I worked here when i was in high school and it was fine but the environment was boring and repetitve. the hiring manager wasnt communicative and the process was slow

I got the job as a courtesy clerk/general merchandiser .I’ve trained one day for dug and that was it. I was suspended for coming into contact with someone who tested positive for the corona virus therefore they made me take two weeks off with pay so when I went back to work I was and still to the day I’m doing a two man job by myself it’s like they have me doing all the dirty jobs like cleaning the bathroom that has been dirty all weekend long until I get back to work to clean them up which should have been done before I returned back to work 48 hours later
Benefits are good after a year.  You are worked very hard with no room for error. Most everyone is miserable. Upper management are complete jerks! Hours are,not consistent.

Fast pace all they care about is numbers the manager of dry department mark didn’t care about his employees only about the numbers you could pull a 99.9 percent on the week and get fired for it I’ve seen it happen to a man that spend many years with the company show the loyalty they have for the employees
Decent place to work, however, my Safeway was rather disorganized. Hours varied wildly week to week, often I would close by myself, since we were understaffed because of the cut to hours.

I was a student while working here and the management wouldn't adjust my hours to accommodate that, so I ended up leaving. Also there are mandatory Union fees, which doesn't feel great when you're working minimum wage.
The managers were fair and the job description was clear. The job was tough because you have to be on your feet for most of the time, but I never felt overworked.

The benefit of this job was that they offered you medical even as a part-time employee. What was a struggle was getting hours. A lot of the time our hours were cut and we would be sent home early or told not to come in at all without much notice.
Worked as a delivery driver in california. One of the main problems was that the equipment essentially sucked, and management had a disconnect with what was going on in field
Mangers doesn't care how they talk to you

With the small bit of time I worked there they gave you about a week to learn your part in the department itself and get to know your coworkers, management outside of the deli was kind at the time I worked there and mainly everyone got along and held conversations with each other. If you were lost or stuck there was someone around to help and explain, when time off was needed the upper managers were very open to help. Near the time I left new management came and began to drastically changed the way the store was operated, change the main people who worked when I started in a way that was so fast it was uncomfortable.
Good place to work, corporate needs to work on communication skills. Employees were great, most customers were good. Product and quality is the best.

Corporate at Safeway cares only about getting quarterly bonuses. As the bonuses are tied to quarterly profits the incentive is to cut any and all corners to keep cost down. What this looks like is cutting hours, not paying for maintenance on equipment and buildings. My store manager did little but lie and was surrounded by conflicts of interest.

Started working at safeway my senior year in highschool and left this month due to moving states. I enjoyed it and I believe it is a good place to work when you're young and the pay was good as well. I lived in oregon so minumum wage was better than other state so I thought I was paid fairly. Had good managers so I can not complain.

Personally I was that favorite and I got basically anything I asked for. The hours, days off, and promotions to places I wanted to be. But that came at the cost of having my individuality. To get there I had to buckle up and shut up about anything I saw that could be against our unions policy. I saw plenty of other amazing employees face retaliation after standing up for themselves in a mildly toxic workplace. I could go on longer about how pay and benefits have drastically changed for the worse and why new employees are treated even worse but I think the turnover rate speaks for it self.
It pays the bills. It is a decent company to work with and I think that it would be nice to have some sort of better management system so we could be more productive.

I worked in the deli at Safeway and it is hands-down the worst job I ever had, we were constantly understaffed and Still expected to clock out on time when I was the only one left to close and take me an extra two hours to actually clean everything before I left at 1 to 2 AM. Also the union does not look after your interest and takes half your paycheck

I have worked at safeway for 8 months as a courtesy clerk and its just constantly being talked to about little things that management screwed up and trickles down to you they treat you like a low life and you have to do everything in there for them everyday i have been nagged at for carts cause we only have like 3 in the store at full occupancy and they send most of the courtesy outside when there is no carts evento grab and have been threaten to be written up countless times for my hoodie even though im outside 45% of my shift and they only have medium company jackets if you really wanna get yelled at and have minimum hours safeways the place for you

I hate the managers here, I tell them whenever I feel sick or need to have my schedule changed and it’s not only like they don’t listen but they go purposely out of their way to make me do more, or to directly put my shift on the hours/days I request not to have them on
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
Great pay, amazing workers. Management is awesome. Feels like home there. Schedule is good. Managers actually care. Your opinion matters. No one left behind

Safeway was a great place to work at, the management is terrible, but somewhat friendly. I applied as a helper clerk and was told to do night shift during the beginning of Covid, everyday. Helped frozen more than anything, which would have been fine if it wasn`t everyday, was told I would get a pay deferential for my night time work, but they set it up to where I`d only receive it for an hour, they exploited my schedule so they could save an extra buck. The co workers are great, but everyone talks about leaving everyday, so that shows something.
Working for a corporation seems to provoke some people to throw others under the bus as an easy way to secure their positions. Regardless of the drama I enjoy providing a service for the public.

If you like working hard to meet unattainable goals and being reprimanded constantly this is the company for you. District managers and merchandisers are downright mean to employees and customers. I’ve heard one merchandiser ask someone “if they were really that stupid.”

Safeway could be a great place to work. Unfortunately the bakery department of the store that I work in is lacking proper leadership. Employees do not feel heard, supported or cared for. This has lead to department infighting, no team atmosphere, and poor overall performance.
The training is bad.  The pay and hours are low.  There is obvious favoritism. Questions go unanswered.  Attitudes are bad and management is unfriendly/inapproachable.
it sometimes feels that were working at a sweat shop. never enough people to do the hetic jobs. seams that our department is always behind.it would be a lot better if we had more people.

Make sure you read everything before you sign anything. Make sure you meet your Union representative And talk to them before agreeing to do anything. Especially when speaking to higher ups. When talking to managers make sure you have proof of each conversation its best to text.  Don't expect to eat Or use the restroom comfortably you only receive two 15 minute breaks A-day.
They talk about customer service but the company is only about the bottom line. It use to be about service but not any longer. Pay and benefits are at 30% of what they use to be.
Good first job very easy going fun productive nice friendly environment good staff light work easy 8 hours never disappoints as a job helpful resourceful

The job itself was nothing special. Management was where my issues lie mostly, but this is typical for most big box stores.  Some managers are good and some are not so good. Some give a lot of constructive criticism and praise, while others use guilt-tripping and manipulative tactics to change your level of performance. Time off is given but getting PTO is  more difficult. I did not stay long enough to use benefits, but after some time they were offered.
Chill people to work with but the hours can be garbage and the pay as well. Managers can range from cool to down right incompetent or just total jerks.
Friendly workspace: workers are easy to talk to, there was paid training, and workers would check up on each other for emotional support when off the clock.

I got lots of experience everywhere in the store. Hard work is noticed, and hard work usually translates to a better job in the store. Some workers don't do a good job, so hard workers tend to pick up the slack.

You have to climb the ladder and earn your seniority, but my hard work is often recognized and rewarded. I really enjoy all of my co workers and work environment And once you’re well versed and skilled in multiple departments and have a variety of skills and are good at multi-tasking, the possibilities are endless.
Don’t work for Safeway they’ll do hours whenever they feel like it. They will promote you but pay stays the same and you end up waiting for the pay to go up based on years worked there
Overworked, under paid, and disrespected by employees and customers. Retail is only good for teenagers' first time job. Would not recommend for anyone else
Unions have sold out and takes 18 months to get the better benefits
Good for a part time job. So the work enviroment is cool and the hours can be good but the work is quite busy and can be stressful. It’s okay. Don’t know if I’d go back

The pay is nice and your backed by a union. It’s difficult to become full time unless you become a department manager. Being a department manager although nice has a lot of problems that comes with it. The schedule that you set for your schedule is never really set because hours are constantly changed by upper management to reduce cost. Any problems that come with the reduced hours falls on you so it’s not uncommon to have the store manager or an operations manager calling or texting you about problems that don’t have enough manpower to fix. If your looking for a job to just work your scheduled shift , get a check and leave. Then this is your job.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

I was hired to work in the spring of 2020 for extra pandemic relief. I was there for 4 months. I had no plans to stay. The people are great we all work hard as a team. Everyone is hungry for hours. Very flexible hours expect to work every holiday.

I worked for the company for 4 years, worked my way up and through too management. Each districts salary managers and cooperates are very tight nit group who do not welcome the growth of others. So if you're looking to be management or promote within I would choose elsewhere.
Great entry level job, no education requirement, can be very physically demanding. There is a union but typically focused on protecting employees with longer tenure.

Everyone there is really nice to work with management acts great while they're in your face but don't expect anybody to ever have your back. Most everyone that works there complains about upper management or even direct Management in every department just seems like it's falling apart they need to revamp and get new management in there that actually cares.

Great place to work, except for the pay.  No set schedule and because they don’t post the following weeks schedule until Sunday, it makes it hard to be able to make personal appointments.  Management is good.  Lots of room for advancement.

It was fun working at Safeway for the customer interaction, cool coworkers and the fast paced environment during busy hours. The regular customers were the only ones who seemed to appreciate you. The managers, well you have to cut some of them slack. It’s a lot of work to do for them, 60-70 hours a week. There were some cool managers and then the not so cool managers.

The job is what it is, hours can sway randomly, they’ll assign you to a new job, and not enough workers on occasions. People are great, pay sucks. The managers are mostly relaxed, but there is one who forgets that we are human and pushes us like we’re robots. Also the union will ask for a large sum of money to pay per month, and will pay that continually for a while. There is typically a large sum of people that will quit randomly. The job will also do its best to not pay their workers more if given the opportunity, and requesting time off will be almost near impossible. The guidelines to follow Covid is also a hazard, as a coworker in the meat department did not wash their hands once after going to the bathroom, and no guarantee they washed it after. There is also no part in keeping it clean aside from the floors. There is also a horrible balance between communication among all departments, where one department fails to work with others and becomes an overall issue with no resolution.
Let’s just say that if you have the skills and the drive this is the right place for you!
Love this place! ITs so cool , I work day to day get paid alot in this company am looking forward to moving on within this company of course! Thank you

Store manager's and the dms are terrible. Don't work here. They are never happy and they're extremely disrespectful. Store managers, even throw their department heads under the bus. They need more training for upper management to filter out expectations. Some store managers can't do anything but they will get on you and make you feel like your less than. And sometimes I think they want you to work off the clock for lack of hiring on there part when we have company.

10 hour work days with an hour and 15 minute drive. Upper management is never happy no matter what you do. Your schedule can change within minutes in the middle of the day.  Get calls or texts at home that you need to come to work. Not an option.

Nice employees and coworkers. Feels like a family. Managers can be nice but some don't appreciate their employees. Over worked and not payed fairly for the amount of work you do. Stressful but you can move between departments.
The bad part about Safeway is that management doesn’t even care about their employees for the most part all they’re good at doing is taking advantage of them

If you get promoted there more weight on your shoulders and if you can’t handle this job will take over your life. I was part of management and if you get that far you best love what you doing or you’ll hate your job cause how much stress it puts on you everyday.

Safeway is a good company to work for.  My experience at my home store was good.  Fellow employees and managers were good to work with.  Unfortunately I was assigned to other stores to help at. I did not enjoy any of those work sites.
Only worked there part time for school but the work was grueling. You are not compensated fairly for how hard you work. Wouldnt go back even if they begged.
It can be difficult at times but the management in the front end is very supportive. I felt like if I needed help during rush hour, I was able to get support.

not sure how anyone can actually work here as a career. not really realistic unless you have a side hustle to pay the other bills, i heard a man working there for over 5 years still didn't get a raise unless the wage changed...
Its great. Everybody gets along for the most part, there is never a dull moment! We stay steady and always have something to do, and management is amazing in my store!
Meat department is lacking in some areas. High egos, trashy hours, bad management. Meat manager will just verbally abuse you instead of trying to help you be a better employee
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
Managers don't care about the employees. The managers care about their salary and what they can do for themselves. A very GREEDY business that I will never work for again.
Management is the worst at this company. They don't care about employees whatsoever and always always side with customers over us even if the customer is flat out harassing us. Terrible place.

I feel like a drone... 8 hours of hardcore human interaction for just minimum wage. These are supposed to be essential workers having to deal with every single person in society and we only get paid minimum wage and only allowed a 10 minute break

When I first got hired I was glad I had the job but until Covid happened Safeway showed their true colors they don’t care about you, they only care if you show up to work or not, The Courtesy Clerk position is mentally tiring and I don’t recommend that position to anyone. This company makes you get carts in 100+ degree weather for 30 minutes.

Company focuses on profit and not customer service. Will purposefully not use allocated payroll budget to try and gain bonuses. Promotion and raises are based on how friendly you are with management team not performance.
It is ok place  to work if you have good management working in bakery  can be fun and demanding must be able to work  at a fast pace.you are always busy

I worked between 6 departments daily, from personal experience at my location I hated it. Managers didn’t care for anyone, nobody did work properly, and I was forced to do so much out of job description. Paid minimum wage for near manager work, if I was lucky I’d get a 5$ coupon tho :,)))) (even tho it only worked for a day on few stuff more than 10$)

We constantly were running low on basic supplies like coffee beans. About 2 or three months in the old Starbucks manager quit and suddenly I had to relearn everything they taught me during training because apparently the old manager wasn't doing it right. Everything became really strict and high stakes.
Great place to work
Learn to hold your own kiddos it's a grocery store.

Worked as a cashier.  Enjoyed working with the public.  They worked with me on the shifts I was available. My husband had surgery and was in a rehab center for three months.  They were very good about working with me so I could spend time with him.
very unprofessional store and management , management does not do anything about harassment , they do not care about your feelings whether you are uncomfortable or not
They don’t train you. They just put you out there with the customers so if that sounds fun then Safeway is for you. They overwork you and don’t offer much help.
It is a growing industry with many changing factors and constantly new expectations to meet. The staff I worked with were nice and friendly. The benefits were good.

Good coworkers for the most part. Don't expect management to do much as far as discipline, unless it is in regards to attendance. If you complain to certain managers they tell the person and it creates hostility. One of the best things is the union. Crazy summers and holidays but plenty of overtime if you're willing to work hard and effectively.
