Horrid experience from day one. Was left alone for computer training on first day for 8 hrs. I was officially trained by an employee that had worked at company less than six months. Was expected to close by myself on my second week of working there. Did not feel properly trained. Rarely ever had time to take my break and stayed late most nights. Understaffed, should have had two bakery clerks on closing shift. I had to call in to be officially terminated, company did not communicate with me. Lacked professionalism from upper management department. Felt stooped from the first day.

Not good at training, learned more from my younger affiliate than my Dept Manager. They let you learn from your mistakes. Prioritize sales over proper procedure. Cut corners to keep within hours. You can't do it all but they still expect you to.

Horrible place to work, no security, no organization, employees were the best part about the job, to be honest, but management was horrible and discrimination was and is real trust me. not about being a team.
Overall it’s a job you will always have with benefits and security. They need to be more adamant about covid requirements and protocols for customers.

enjoy working there great people great atmosphere just not enough hours . Its mostly part time employees & you get more hours the longer you have been there which is fair , however I can not afford my bills on this job alone
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
It isnt a bad work place, but the management when i was there had trouble communicating and while the people were great as people, they weren't always the best at working

I love my job in my two in a half years of working with safeway and i have gotten two promations and am niw a department manager with my sights for higher and there willing to help me make it there there are even willing to help pat for collage and gd classes if you are willing to put in the efforts!
You always have something to do so it’s a very productive job . You will never get bored of working because you are always moving. Some things can be hard to carry but you can always ask for help.
Coworkers are very friendly. I worked here part time while going to school. Benefits were very good for a part time job. Management was always friendly.

Worst company I have ever worked for. Managers are the only people who get any sense of incentive to work hard and many of them will treat their employees terribly if they don't bend over backwards for them.

Working at Safeway was one of the worst jobs I had due to management. The Deli was always understaffed and underpaid. There were many days I worked off the clock because you would get yelled at for working overtime but we were so understaffed and needed desperate help. They only thank you for being helpful but give nothing to show for it.
Double standards everywhere, managers are inexperienced and don’t care for their employees unless they are willing to show up to work and face managerial problems every single day

I enjoyed the work itself, but the department manager was uptight, impatient, & quick to scold over incorrectly completed tasks, though said manager wasn't proactive to explain how tasks should & should not be done in order to avoid the mistakes in the first place. Co-workers were chill, friendly, & very helpful, but I was often told how to do things completely differently from what the manager expected, leading to more scolding. Again, I really liked the work, but with the manager's unhelpfullness & negativity, & lack of sufficient communication among department staff, it was getting too stressful. I decided to quit.
I worked with Albertsons for 13 years and loved it. The second the merged with Safeway i hated it. I was just a number and I lost my management job due to the merger and stores closing down

I loved working with most of the employees. They are hard working. It is not the employees, it's the management. Management do not know how hard we work everyday. If it wasn't for us there would be no store.

Very good company to work for, mainly worked over night, no customers for the 6 hours, with gave us plenty of time to stock and recover the store. Help with any opening tasks check and walk management before going home. I do miss working there. Room for growth and move it up if you're willing to put in the work.

I really enjoyed this job. Working at customer service was a fun routine I could fall into, and I didn't mind helping people. Managers were very helpful and kind, and I generally didn't have any issues.
Worked at Safeway to help my family pay the bills at the start of the pandemic. I quickly left after being schedule 40+ hour work weeks when I made it known that I was a graduating senior in college.
Promotions and sales happen all the time allowing guests to shop with confidence and affordability. Friendly staff and management always trying to improve the store.

It's an alright job, but I feel like my hard work goes unnoticed most of the time. No matter how hard you work, the management team is too busy to notice. Don't expect any positive encouragement after working hard. It's good experience for a 17 year old high school student.

Job was pretty easy. You go in, cut fruits and veggies, put em in correct containers, label them and put them on the shelves. The hours were steady. The days would jumble from time to time. Met great people there and they made everything easier.
Job is not bad if you stay out of the drama. Union is awesome and works hard for us. Benefits are beyond awesome and affordable. PTO adds up quickly.
it was an awesome place to work friendly co workers good pay friendly wprk environment very helpful during training a lot of opportunities to move up if n you are motivated
My coworkers managers and customers were great and I would do anything for my store. Conversely, corporate only seems to be interested in maximizing profit at all cost.

I have this job 110% but no matter how long I work or how hard I tried, they would always find something to say about my work not being good enough. They want you to get everything done, but there's so much they give you to do it's near impossible to finish in your shift. Then if you DO get it all done but it takes longer than your shift, they also get on you. You can't win either way!
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

I have a hard time every day working for Safeway. Ever heard of retaliation? That happens  at this company. It’s hard working for a place where nothing has anything positive to say and it starts with management.
Where do I even begin, I would recommend teens to work here if they are looking to get started in the workforce. There is little to no advancement when working with this company

No training, district manager and assistant manager blamed the assistant manager for everything that went wrong. Cashiers are pushed to much to sign up people for club cards, collect donations from customers. No work life balance for people working in store, required to work all holidays including Christmas. Customers complaints are always right even when several witlessness all say they are wrong  leading to employees receiving discipline, while the customer receives an apology and a free $25 gift card. The stress, tension, and worry caused by this company isn't worth the compensation. My advise, DO NOT WORK HERE. It is horrible!! As an assistant manager was paid 40 hours and required to work 50. Common to work 70 hours a week . They don't care about the employees.

Safeway was my first job. It was good for building customer service skills, and it was nice to be greeted by regular customers. Most of my coworkers were really nice. Management was a little questionable with scheduling.
Loved working here even though it wasn’t for that long I felt that there was a real community in the store. I would recommend working there to a friend anytime.
Working here was alright. The managers at my location would favorite a lot of the other employees. They also never disciplined anyone for not doing their job. Overall the experience was okay.
I would not recommend working for this company. The wages are not competitive, no room for advancement and they need better management. They do not seem to give full time hours.

i worked in the starbucks kiosk but i got to know most of the different people in the departments. management was childish, and immature. they all picked favorites. management of the kiosk ? a joke. was not qualified for the job. i was hired way after them and i would have been more qualified for he position. i was doing half of their work anyways! manager was fake to my face constantly. complained about my closes, but they would always leave stuff undone, not stocked,or not cleaned. left her duties for closing employees to do. wouldnt answer the phone when we needed help. wouldnt EVER come in to help staff. always left during the busiest parts of the day. ignored big issues. ignored all complaints from staff. managers of the safeway always took her side. never listened to any complaints from employees. ALSO, when covid first hit, their percautions were not up to par. I was cussed at one day for telling my boss i wasnt feeling good and didnt feel comfortable working that day. :) how lovely.  i was never recognized for the hard work i did. i was also ALWAYS guilted into coming in on my days off, or for not coming in when i have chronic illnesses.

I started as a courtesy clerk when I was 17 and moved around to different departments, like front desk, floral and cashier. It was cool, the hours around the holidays were always funky though. Good experience overall.
Fantastic place to work! Especially if you're a high schooler and need to look for a place to work that doesn't require previous work experience. Minimum wage but that's expected.
SAFEWAY treats their employees with respect and they acknowledge the hard work you put in.  The union gives you great health benefits.  Overall I had a great experience working for the company.

Great starting place for those trying to build a basic resume. Nothing special. I worked here in high school and it helped build my confidence so I could move on to a different job after graduating. Flexible hours, but you are either super bored or way too overworked.
Overall
Job sucked got treated as if I didn't know a thing about deli products and my team wasn't very helpful, making it hard to learn how to complete job related tasks

It is retail, no weekends off. Learn on your  own . If they can get you to do a job out of your job description, they will not pay you for it. Keep your eyes open, keep in mind at all times your specific job description you were hired for.
Fine place for temporary work but progression is horrible, not a good place to make a career. Your experience at the workplace completely depends on your managers.

I worked at the Seattle Madison Street location for exactly two days. The communication of the staff was poor. I never even received orientation or workplace training. The store manager is not a nice person - disrespectful, aggressive, and impatient. Other locations might be favourable, but this one was not, and after two days of this, I could see it was not going to work out. I do not recommend working here.
low starting pay and Poor management; management lacks insight and genuine concern for its employees; hours vary drastically from daily to weekly; poor scheduling
I worked here a courtesy clerk. Job was extremely average, and whatever you are expecting is likely what you are going to get. Most of the coworkers and customers are friendly.
Good work good pay good lifestyle good commute good place good people good colors good pets good flooring good treats good friends good times good muffins
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

I started out as a Pharmacy Technician. The process was very slow, almost three weeks! Horrible place! No work Structure at all.They make you work 10 hour shifts, with only 30 Minute break. I kid you not!!!

Being a courtesy clerk isn't necessarily hard but I couldnr find the right word for it the job is like 5 or 6 different jobs pushed into 1 and the pay isnt all that great for it at my store im expected to do almost everything very fast and sometimes on my own which can get overwhelming quick when your name is being called over and over to different spots of the store

Good place to work if you don't have a family and enjoy working at a fast pace with long hours, Great benefits.  If you are looking for a place of employment where you will feel appreciated, you will not find it there.
Good for if your in school. Good if your not because you get raises.  They dont hire much cashiers anymore because of those self check out things.

I’ve worked for Safeway for 5 years and know every thing about the way they work. Pretty much your expected to learn extremely fast and work fast and if you don’t , youl get demoted or treated badly , it’s just the way it is. The management there gets treated badly and they take that out on you . It’s not really a good place to work. People who advance are just chosen and get lucky. This can be scene blatantly with people who work extremely hard don’t get promoted compared to others who do half as much and move up some how. It’s a bad retail environment so don’t expect much. The biggest plus is that you learn a lot from talented people some times .

When I applied at Safeway, the application listed the job as full-time. But, when they hired me, they said it was actually an official part-time job. Then they gave me part-time hours. It eventually got bad enough that they only gave me a half shift a week - that's four hours of work every week. They refused to release the schedule until the Friday before, and the schedule was subject to change. One day, my scheduling was changed without my knowledge, and they threatened to fire me for not showing up according to my new schedule. Overall, don't apply unless you don't care about hours.

I enjoyed working at the Danville location, I had decided to transfer closer to where I live and unfortunately I regret it. Moving to a closer location didn’t work out for me because it changed my hours to hours that I was unable to work and could not switch my shift in that department and if I wanted to switch shifts I would have to be hired in a different department. The management there to me was treating employees unkind and unfair.

Managers are absolute a holes and could care less about their employees.  All they care about is if they're gonna get yelled at by upper management or not and it's a terrible place to work.  People come and go so frequently because it doesn't take long to realize how much it sucks there.  They absolutely hoe their employees too.  If you finish your work early they ask you to go home early to save money.  They offer no overtime really and even if you want to work overtime, they don't even pay time and a half or anything even close to it being worth it to work extra.  They cut people's hours all the time without warning or reason so if you do go in just go for 8 hours and make sure you get paid.  Speaking of pay their pay is embarrassingly low.  I already mentioned that they don't pay anything extra for overtime, which is probably to discourage overtime since they woulrn't want to pay people extra anyway.  They laugh if you ask to change positions and they could care less for students if they have to work on the days they have classes too.  And don't bother asking to change your hours or call in because they don't see school as a good enough excuse.

This particular Safeway was NOT a place I could work in, for even a year. To start they gave me 1 shirt and 1 apron.....1 shirt......not 2 or 3.  Just 1. I dont wear that many clothes to wash to make Load to add my work shirt to every couple days!! They hire too many people and barely give you any hours and literally FORCE you to join a union or you can't work there. THAT IS ILLEGAL!!  They did NOT do as they said with their radio advertisement. They did not pay you for training as mentioned. They have great benefits if you're a full time employee yet NO ONE but the managers have full-time which they will give no one enough hours to get any benifits. Although the manager wants to stop thieves (a very hard working man) his hands are tied because the people over him are willing to fire him as a result of confronting them. As a result thieves go unpunished ands its pretty much a free for all for them when they don't get caught. We have a bathroom where druggies and homeless people make there own and can take over an hour to leave or until the manager or security has to bang on the door. I left because I absolutely HATED working for a company who builds their brand off of lies and finds loopholes to not provide. We even had a survey that cheated us out of telling the surveyor what we really felt. So they know they are feeding staff horse manure. I did enjoy my job though. I absolutely LOVED the people I worked with and working with the customers...well most of the customers. Its just the bad really outweighed the good here. Some customers literally saw how difficult it is working

The only reason I gave it two stars instead of one is because work/life balance is pretty good and pay can be decent if you move up into management. The management is terrible they only care about putting money in their pockets and not about their employees at all. I have to stop myself from walking out almost daily. They like to constantly use fear tactics and threats as a way to motivate people.

Don't work here! Your hours will be cut with no notice at all. Safeway doesn't pay a living wage bat all! I was the only employee in my department for 6 hours. No break in that time. I didn't even have coverage to leave to use the bathroom.

I was hired with Safeway and I was happy about it. I read some employee reviews before hand to understand what situation I was coming into. This store management is not really good at all. No communication between management and staff unless your buddy/buddy with them. Management let’s long time staff do as they please. Some employees are too talkative to other staff and customers which creates really long lines in the store. The fact that I was hired and left to figure out who’s management staff (which by the way didn’t introduce themselves to me until I had to introduce myself to them) shows me that this store is very micromanage. 2nd day of my training I was doing my training on the computer and the lady who hired me left to go home. She didn’t tell me that she was off or who to go to for help. One of the assistant manager has a superior attitude.

The pay is pretty decent but the management here is terrible. The grocery department orders are terrible. They want you to stack 6 thousand pounds of product on double pallets that have no structure to them at all.

Great value for time and energy spent in return for excellent compensation, including generous starting benefits and vacation + weekly pay, nice work environment, very much enjoy working for this company!
Not paid enough to get own place.
I have learned a lot and am very grateful for the opportunities I have been given but working every holiday and weekend has taken a toll on me.   It is high stress

I had a great time working there. Management was excellent they gave me the opportunity to move up quickly and compensated me extremely well. I will miss working there especially my managers very good people. Thank you for the opportunity im sorry to be leaving.

Gets pretty tiresome. Over worked at some point and don't really get appreciated by the hard work you. Just get put down for the things you couldn't get accomplished through the work day. And training kinda sucks just a sink or swim type thing.

They used to invest a great deal in training Managers. I actually requested very detailed training during my salary negotiations. I began as a 2nd Assistant Manager, was promoted to 1st Assistant in 3 weeks, and I was eligible for Store Manager Training within a year. After certifying as a Store Manager, I became a trainer for my district. The training I received was amazing. I am in contact with other former managers, and we all agree that Safeway’s SMRA Certification made it easy to “ace” future processes.

Some P.I.Cs are amazing, others feel like more of a boss around type rather then a leader that should help keep the store running. Managers get all the over time they want but no one else is allowed any unless under rare circumstances. So much could be improved to make things run more smoothly but nothing is ever that simple at Safeway. If you try calling out and you get a supervisor, be ready to feel like you're worthless and threatened to lose your hours because they think "you cant handle it" because you're human and dont feel well for a day. And if you're a helper clerk get ready to do way more work then mostly everyone  and get paid the same as someone who just sits in the gas station on their phone all day.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Don't underestimate how tough night crew can be. I struggle to keep a decent sleep schedule even after a few months. The work is good and I can listen to audio books while I work and am left alone most of the night. I like what I do but am struggling to justify continuing to work here because I can make more elsewhere and get the benefit of working in the day.
This was once a great place to work but not anymore. The pay is disgraceful and they do not appreciate their employees. It is very sad and disheartening!
My first job as a kid. Good to understand basics as a cashier. Job was not overwhelming.  My managers were good resources.

They teach you how to handle a hectic work environment, but that's it. They give minimum training and rack on more and more. If you're a stronger worker, they will have you pick up the slack of everyone else and you're in trouble if there are days (i.e. busy with customers) where you can't do it all. They will have you manage but not give you a management position or the pay. They won't properly address issues with other coworkers. Having anything repaired is like pulling teeth (i.e. hole with mold in the wall) and safety issues are often looked over. It gets more and more draining the longer you're there.

Your experience will vary depending on which store you work in. From my experience, it is the assistant manager that will be tough to work with, not the store manager. Lower level supervisors are the best. They care about your happiness and are lovely people trying to make their living. Pay is very, very low in comparison to other grocery stores last I checked. I worked part-time so I don't know anything about how the benefits are. The atmosphere is nice, low-lit and quiet. Getting approved to take off for a shift can be difficult, but super easy if you have someone to cover or switch with you. Overall management was fair and did not breathe down your neck as long as you were doing your job. The work is very easy with no stress, unless a customer induces their stress on you for something. After you have worked there a few months you can ask to move to another department. How long it will take is unknown, but it's possible.

Safeway is a good job but it’s hard when you have worked for a company for many years that doesn’t really care about you even though you are one of the hardest working employees in the store. I have made some incredible people that I call my friends.

Very difficult you either freeze during the winter with little hours or almost die of heat stroke during the summer and need a drs note just  for water in your 8 hour shift and bosses won't protect me its a bullied environment sadly people in this position stay for years feeling like they can never get anything any better if they didn't quite within in the 1st week or 2 most do but its like high school drama all the time the Union seems the strongest on the most help. Though I would give them a 5 stare but document everything.
I worked part-time due to a furlough/termination at my primary job due to covid-19 (China/Wuhan virus) on 03/17/2020.
Overall
No complaints good learning experience. I recommend working there easy job . Good workplace got the hours I needed/wanted while having a chance to meet new people.

Worked there for 5 years. I don’t know why. New employees were starting out at the same wage I was making.... after 5 years. Flexible scheduling, but high turnover. A good job for high schoolers looking for their first job.

Our company tries to have us be under 16 hours a day in our home shopper department. This isn’t even enough to get breaks covered. Our manager is amazing and encouraging, but upper management is constantly on our butts basically wanting us to run around like chickens with our heads cut off 24/7

Honestly all I can say is this job is not worth it. Getting carts in 100+ degree weather is terrible, the managers barely even care if you’re having a heat stroke they only care if the lot is clear. I would just recommend staying away from the courtesy clerk position. One plus is that they’re super flexible and understanding with scheduling.

I really enjoyed my time at Safeway. There was always a great sense of camaraderie among myself and fellow employees. The managers were usually very helpful and supportive. The hours were usually very flexible and the pay was outstanding considering my position within the company (I was a Courtesy Clerk). I always felt like I was appreciated for what I did. Helping customers was my favorite part of the job. They were always so nice and fun to talk to. The only reason I quit was due to concerns with COVID-19. I would definitely consider going back again.
it was great in the beginning but after a while you realize how over worked you are for such little pay, have to wait after a year of employment to get benefits.

This was a terrible Safeway to work at. The managers don’t care about you and honestly you were under paid for the work that you do. The workers at this location are not the friendliest either. I only encountered one nice and helpful coworker. I could not stand working for this Safeway! Don’t apply here if you value your time, sanity, or paychecks.

I had my first job here and it was a horrible experience. Management clearly chooses favorites based on personality and does not notice the laziness of these courtesy clerks. Although some coworkers were a pleasure to work with, others gossiped a lot.

My time at Safeway was great. I loved my coworkers and the position I held. However, the management team needs more work. It felt at times that we, as workers, were nothing but business pawns. We would be called into work on multiple days off and shunned if we didn't come in. The management didn't see that we have lives outside of work.
So called "managers" are untrained with sloppy work ethic. Do not expect much, this place is good for emergencies, otherwise, keep looking elsewhere.

I spent most of my working life there a very dependable pay check I do fill thankful for that I would recommend it to anyone for employment I would recommend having any health care needs and treatment at any of facilities to receive world class care.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

It gets worse every year. I don't feel there is a solutions for at better experience at the location where I work. It"s an unhealthy and unsafe environment to work in. Moral it very low. It's all work and no reward, except your pay check at the end of the week. There are employees that actually work and earn their pay and there are employees that should have been terminated a long time ago.

It was horrible but everyone was so gossipy and im young but I dont like that stuff and when your managers are constantly talking about their adult lifes it's just no appropriate. And my manager never liked me I work all the time long hours and I did my job extremely well but nothing was ever good enough for her and it became a really hostile environment.

experience is now looked at as high expectation balanced with being  a financial liability as labor tightens.  They often look over major issues to address the flavor of the day. Product knowledge is lacking and training budget makes it diificult.

I worked as a courtesy clerk so I typically just assisted the cashiers with bagging groceries, helped customers carry groceries to their car, and performed daily go-back tasks. My coworkers at my location were all friendly and laid back. My manager was very motivating and encouraged everyone to work to their potential. The hardest part of the job was rude customers or sketchy people coming into the store. The most enjoyable part of the job was being paid weekly.

The deli is fine when you are working in the back and don't have to deal with as many customers. The job is not easy, just tedious, however the company will never side with you on an issue, you do not have the right to refuse service and my experience with higher ups and management at the company are not good. I constantly felt belittled at this company and never felt like I had the support and training to become successful at this job. The training is a joke. They don't really train you, they just make you watch some videos and throw you into the job and then get angry when you don't do things the way they do. I received my first write up this way.  The company is also paying less than most company for starting positions at other companies. I had to apply for the same job at a different company to leverage a pay raise, and when they did give me a pay raise they cut my hours so that I was still making the same amount of money.  I would honestly the reader go apply at Walmart first where they have a chance to make more money than they do at safeway.
Young women will be harrased, stolen from, gossips about, thrown under the bus for others mistakes, and ridiculed. All which happened to me and other young women at Safeway.
Managers don’t care about you the employees are treated like peasants customers are mean working though the pandemic was awful we weren’t compensated at all

I only worked there for one day because of what I saw. In the break room people do not wear there face masks when sitting next to each other. The workers in the deli department don't regularly wash there hands they only change their gloves. People are very complacent which could lead to a covid outbreak. But I will say that most of the customers did wear masks.

I enjoyed my time While working at SafewayThe coworkers I met were amazing the job experience I obtained was fantastic but the management was terrible I had to leave due to consistent bullying from management constant Criticism with no support or Positive feedback From management despite working so hard to stand out and be the best employee I could be. You're capped out In regards to pay, unless you go into management you will not make any more than 14.50 an hour! There is hardly any Room for advancement And the management plays favorites  With employees that don't even deserve it. If they don't like you they will give you one day a week and basically make you quit, because it's a Union job they can't fire you unless it's for a good reason And that is the only benefit of working for Safeway.
Don't waste your time working here. There are no opportunities for advancement. Any other grocery store will start you out paying more. Horrible management.
work at safeway if you dont want stress, but you are down with a chill job where you basically don't have to think whatsoever. this gets boring if u want to be mentally stimulated.

Working in the deli is like working at Popeyes,A busy take out Chinese restaurant and subway sandwiches all in one job.Iv’e learned about preparing fried foods and proper temperatures,different kinds of meats and cheeses.It can be very fast paced and because of the location,some of the customers are horrible.After 40 years in customer service,I’ve never been treated so horrible by the customers.Very verbally abusive.It’s mentally and emotionally draining.I usually go to bed soon as I get home and sleep for 12-14 hrs and get up and do it all over again because I feel like my soul has been sucked out of my body..It’s often difficult to get daily tasks competed as well as take care of the customers as well.The positive points are my co-workers.A couple of them I’ve bonded with in the short time that I’ve been employed there.

I can not stress this enough I would love to work with them longer but they think they can play with my money. I asked and asked for more hours or a raise and they don’t give it to me cause “there’s bigger problems” that apparently I don’t know about
For a first job its fine as long you plan to not stay too long managers disappear, some coworkers think they are managers, hours change constantly, cut hours with little to no warning

I got good hours when I first started but as time went on I started getting less and less hours and because of seniority I don’t have much options. We are understaffed a lot and customers can be very rude.

Kind of felt a bit of a stigma from my manager, but work was generally easy to learn and many of my co-workers are all great people. Running the express lane on a Sunday afternoon on my first day was not fun.

I worked there in multiple departments and worked very hard for the company and was not appreciated at all. I would get bullied by a couple of employees including management. They would play favoritisms and treat their friends better than the other employees. Felt like I was in high school every time I came to work. Horrible people to work with and always drama. My advice is Don’t work here.
I'm going to preface this with saying this:
I really liked the people I worked with.  There are opportunities for advancement.  The schedule is somewhat flexible, management will work with you..

Don’t work in the dot com department. This department is in charge of shopping for groceries ordered online and then delivered to the customer. They treat their employees unethically and set them up to fail. This company not only cuts hours but doesn’t allow overtime. Most shifts are so understaffed that the days work doesn’t get done in time. When an order is late, we are not allowed to notify the customers. Which creates very cranky customers that end up calling us and cursing us out because of a situation that we had no control over. The corporate office demands highly unrealistic goals. When these goals are inevitably not met, they tell us that we are “just not trying hard enough.” Most of my shifts end up being 10 hrs but I barely get to manage a ten minute break in the entire shift. As I said earlier, don’t work for dot com. It’s a dumpster fire.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

I have not worked there since 2012.  I can not comment on Safeway at this time.  When I worked there, I really enjoyed my position at Safeway.  If I ever relocated back to California, I would definetly reapply at Safeway.

I worked at Safeway twice and I hated it both times, managers are rude, they get mad when you need an override like your asking for the fun of it. Customers were annoying and weird, especially the men. Overall wouldn't recommend, the pay wasn't even pocket change. Highly suggest you don't work for the one in Towson. People are always stealing and they get mad when you don't catch them like your security or something, and you don't get paid enough for it anyway. The managers where LITERALLY the worst, words can't even explain the bs I had to go through on the daily until I said f that and I quit.Overall you need a strong mental capacity if you decide to work there
it's an okay place of employment. Lots of standing and alot of customer complaints about everything.  It can be very stressful and draing. You will work every holiday.
Heavy pace work. Good pay.  There's some cons but the pros outweigh the cons. I recommend working here. It's a workout and you will be in shape . Apply and apply
Gave me a chance to show what I can be and what I can do for my self and my job the management team shows me positive feedback and makes me feel that I can accomplish anything.
It was ok working for safeway I learned a lot and I made new friends and it made me happy. I did the same thing every day I also worked in the floral department

I generally liked this job, enjoyed working with the customers and coworkers. Learned a lot about the food I prepared and working on large scale. And work was very consistent and easy to accomplish as it was organized and standardized. But saw a lot of saddening management practices, such as a pregnant employee who was cut hours until she couldn't get paid maternity leave. Heard repeated bullying or harassment be reported and no reprecussions or change. It was really disappointing to see in a regional store.

Back in 2016 I worked at a Safeway in Highlands Ranch, CO. It was my first job ever, and I had landed a position as a courtesy clerk in the store. I had the basic duties of bagging groceries, bringing carts in, bagging trash, facing an aisle, and pushing milk forward. Seems easy enough, but I only sat there for two weeks before quitting. I was not given any instructions, and instead was thrown into whatever odd job the manager needed me to do. I was not given kneepads, I was not allowed to take any breaks, I was not given any equipment to help with bringing in the carts. Those things are heavy, and when only half of the wheels turn, and you have no way to lighten that load, and when your boss expects you to move at least 20 of them at once, it gets exhausting both mentally and physically. The fact that my shifts were only four hours long, and I was crying at the end of them every single time, either from how bad my body hurt from the physical exertion, or from the mental stress of abusive management. If I had to choose between working at a Safeway, and chugging spoiled milk, i'd choose the milk.
It use to be a great place to work but then Albertsons took over and its been all down hill since then. You also got to be in good with management if you want to succeed in this company..
PROS:

Safeway is a good company to work for! The only hang-up that I have or dislike that I have is not with the company. It's the fact that the co-vid 19 pandemic has pretty much put a halt on me attaining my meat cutter certification. Other than that no quarrels.
Work-life balance
Not the greatest, but it was a paycheck. Management didn't know how to properly manage staff, whether due to poor experience or terrible expectations for their role.

This is a great place for students to work, even if you’re in a management position, but there are way too many unrealistic expectations that are crammed down management’s throat, which then leads to a stressful and chaotic work environment. I would not recommend Safeway as a permanent place of work because it will have a negative impact on your mental health. I worked for this company for 7 years as supervisor and though there is room for advancement, get ready to play a lot of passive aggressive political games to move up. One of the worst parts of working for Safeway is that the stock was public so your labor depends on how the market and economy is doing. Sometimes you’d barely have enough help during the day, and most of the time you’d have no support, even on the busiest days of the month. This is not a company that cares for its employees or customers and they make sure you know it.
Overall

My only real complaint is how manegment rarely backs their employees while dealing with particularly rude or awful customers. They tend to placate and give them whatever they want. But, there's always a chance to cross train in multiple departments giving you more opportunity for hours, pay raises and growth.

At the hiring events they tell you what you want to hear and when it comes to working it’s the complete opposite. They are hiring a lot because it is hard to keep people with what they are promised. On my first day of training I was sent home 12 minutes into my shift. Before getting hired I said I would only work there if I was guaranteed certain days off for my law enforcement test to which they agreed. They made me quit my good job that I had and on the first day when I asked the superintendent he said he could t give me days off and that he didn’t want me to waste his time and sent me home I called HR and complained but since it was my word against his they gave the benefit of the doubt to him. When I came back they tried to make me quit by telling me that I no longer had a schedule and had to call an hour before work to see if I was needed. They eventually terminated me because my production was unacceptable. How could it be unacceptable if I barely worked? As soon as my percentage went up they stopped calling me in. There’s a reason why people don’t last there and they are constantly hiring. It’s not worth the pay

I have been working for Safeway since 2015. I love helping every customer and had no issues with staff members at work, and met new people along the way. The company help me develop new skills. When difficult situations arrive, I was able to solve them with a positive mindset.
I love working there but the manager and district manager put too much pressure on employees. They don’t work with your schedule or give you days off you request. It’s very toxic environment.

In a year and a half High turnover not much training if you did,not have skills all ready. training supervision weak. Saw health code violations some employees lacked english skills like on the phone which resulted in bad customer service.Promises made for advancement scuddled when Department Managers moved on to other jobs. Weak interpersonal communications .Fly by the seat of your pants no reviews at all that mattered rigged level one pay scale who in 2020 gives  A dime or nickel raises its not 1920. Bad Covid prevention Customers with no Masks and Manners harassing employees over items not available no Security. In your book do you want a bombastic Night Crew Stocking Manager too make Decisions not in there Wheel house just off the Handle..
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

I work hard in the bakery department, and making doughs for French breads, sourdough breads, baguettes. I also breakout frozen productions to set-up to bake the next morning. I also organize bakery products in a freezer, and I clean the freezer.

Without going into specific times, repeatedly shifts would be mischeduled or left unattended, manager never looked out for employees or customers. Never giving help when departments needed it only when convenient to him. Repeatedly treated staff poorly to the point where some would cry or not feel comfortable at work.
Safeway was my first real job, working there was my least favorite experience due to the way my managers had us closers stay hours later than scheduled even when we couldn’t.
Work-life balance
Safeway is a great company to work for they care not only about their employee's but truly care about their customers buy having great prices, fresh quality products at a great value

I was the only one who ever actually did their job when it came to the parking lot and collecting carts outside. In the break room most of my coworkers were blatantly and vocally racist toward customers who had come through earlier and other coworkers.
A good place to work but hard to make a career. A lot of staff are underpaid for there position but is a good job to start off at or have as a part time position.

Too much rat race and none organization. Very bad scheduling too many cashiers when their not needed, Not enough when their needed. There needs to be a front store manager not just an general and a store manager.

Dont waste your time. The hiring manager made me believe I would be doing a customer service field register etc. I git no support on my first day of training.  Stuck me in a computer room fir 9 hoursand never checked in me. Second day my last day. I thought I would be doing register and expected me to be a janitor....the store manager is rude unhelpful and I felt harrassment from all levels. I walked out....dont waste your time at Safeway

Safeway pharmacy is not the place to work. They decreased our hours but still have the same work load. So we are staying 2 hours after close of business and working like dogs. This is working at a feverish pace. And we are up 200% per our manager. I don’t know how the managers sleep at night. Pharmacists are making mistakes.  They don’t care about providing a safe work place. It’s fraud waste and abuse. If you are in pharmacy school switch to another major. There are no jobs and the pay will be very minimum. My tech left to go work for more money at Chipotle. $10.40 an hour for tech pay. Wow.
So fun to work at. I loved my cowokers. nice place. Good size store not to big not to small just right. They have a small deli and a big bakery. I miss working there.
the job is not diffiult but management can be taxing.  There is no appreciation of the employees and the disrespectul manner in which employees are treated is like we do not matter.

A typical day at work includes finishing everything I have to do within the first hour of being there so for the next 8 hours of work I would walk around the store aimlessly. Everything you will do is so repetitive it will make time go insanely slow.
Work-life balance
Good place for work if you don’t need that many hours, but sometimes work load can be a lot and turnover rate is high. Also not much room to advance..

Liked job and like my management and coworkers this job was okay however the pace sucked and not having insurance for a whole year sucked if you're just looking for a job I would recommend this company you get paid weekly at least

Worked as produce clerk. Job was straightforward but there is a massive amount to learn. You make products (fruits and vegetables) look nice and throw away the bad ones. Restock and rotate products from the backroom. Manager was flexible and the crew are all great. Night shifts can be extremely slow and boring about half the time. Underpaid for how much work there is.
I worked graveyard shifts for about a year and it was pretty straightforward and chill. Its hard working nights sometimes but the job was pretty relaxed once you were done with the heavy lifting.

When I worked there I couldn't get a solid shift at a certain time every week because they fill spots where nobody else is working to meet the number of workers. So basically you have to work everything around this and it can be a pain. At the job is where most of the pain comes from though. You are tasked with cleaning the store, running items back to aisles, getting carts from outside and bringing them back to the front of the store in hot weather, at my particular Safeway there was a constant leak in the roof I had to clean up regularly as well as the occasional bathroom cleaning. If it sounds like a lot that is because it is, but on its own I think a janitor would be another job they should be hiring for because you also are responsible for doing all of that while bagging groceries at the front end during rush hours. It can be a rush or a drag but usually always stressful. And the pay is completely unfair at 10.5 an hour.

My time at Safeway was more or less a good experience. When you first start out, everyone is really nice and willing to help out! Over time the management seemed to not care anymore. The pay started out at minimum wage and I was able to get a small raise of 50 cents after working 6 months
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
It was an amazing job . just had to move to an better opportunity when the right time came for change . It is always good to grown  from job . and learn different things

I started tis job when I was 17, I am now 35 and it has become a really bad place to work. Ever since Albertsons has taken over the work enviormnemnt has gone down. This used to be a career and employees were paid fair, but now every time a contract come up the pay does not go up that much. I can't even earn a living wage in the area that I live.

Overall have made some good friends here but the pay and lack there of is terribly!! And when you ask management they always tell you talk to the union who is no one or no where to be found!! No benefits as everyone is considered part time unless a manager!!
Good environment. Not enough pay for a full time job  wish there was better benefits and a better store manage, one that cares about his/her workers overall other workers are nice

I worked as a fruit cutter. Our department (fruit and vegetable cutting) was always understaffed while management kept expecting us to crank out more and more chopped fruits and veggie packages while still going out onto the floor every hour to check and document the temperature of the cooling racks where our produce is displayed. Most afternoons I was left to chop alone and that was no fun! The one good thing I got from this job was learning how to cut fruits efficiently. I wouldn't recommend this position (or probably most positions here - the people working here could be rather iffy).

This place was highly abusive toward its employees. They would regularly shift you to multiple departments in a day due to a shortage of staffing and payroll and expect you to get 16-20 hours of work done in an 8 hour shift without any aid. Management was verbally abusive, disrespectful, and condemning if there was any failure to complete all tasks and expectations within the small time frame given, regardless of how quickly and efficiently you worked. Breaks were a rare commodity. Working for Safeway was easily the most toxic and abusive workplace I have ever been a part of.
Nothing better then being surrounded daily with great people. It's like being independently contracted for your position with some mention of what works for another co-worker if needed.

This was one of the worst companies I have ever worked for. The management is abusive, the store manager should be fired. She was the worst manager I ever worked for. She made the work environment toxic and let other department heads be abusive to the employees with no consequences. The union is worthless too. Save your money and work elsewhere.
Loved my job until the Store manager was relocated and the assist store manager took his place. It all went down hill fromthere. She saw to it that I was replaced.
We are trained one way, then asked to do things about way in most tasks. Communication between management and employees sporadic. Often understaffed.

During the interview process, I was asked to come back 3 separate times. The first was with a supervisor who worked in a department that had nothing to do with the Pharmacy, and had no idea the questions to ask for a pharmacy position. The second person to interview me was another supervisor that had no idea I was applying for the Pharmacy Tech position. The third interviewer was the pharmacy manager who was 2 weeks new himself and had no idea there was even an existing position open. And he was telling me that he really had no idea how badly unorganized this store was until he started working there.
Its a great store mangers are helpful and great work schedule could be flexible if needed and its a great environment for you to work and learn also have fun
fast pace working environment, you will meet tons of people and learn great customer service skills. I've learned a lot about the people in the community and thankful to work.
It was good to be around people like me and be able to share our experiences to make us more interested into the work we put into the things we have to complete.

Yeah so my boss Sydney one of the best bosses Ive had but the store director was a joke they let clerks enact as management & lets just say unfit abused ability were never good at it targeted, and descriminated me as a worker cuz they knew I was a worker did all my duty's and jobs timely however so say and when I was a courtesy and even then some would pawn off all other jobs on me of others even the other clerks with same job they'd notice me doing my duties and them doing nothing for hours and still expected and yelled at me for it and refusing to do others jobs at times, the failing people in charge tried to do my name bad said I refused to do my job when I refused to do the people's who were getting compensated for ripping off the company they'd never give me cash I needed to get by or pay bills hours needed no matter how much I proved myself, tried to treat me like a child when I had a child to provide for.,
safeway is a very good company for fresh food and with great service and workers.
I loved working with my team and the patients. The management was always involved and got to know us personally. It was a great experience and like my second family.
It’s a very welcoming fun place to work, some people can be difficult and rude at times there is also slight drama but the pay is fair and hours are a bit all over the place

Manager I had had no clue of her job. Obligated the float pool because she didn’t want to do the job. Her daddy was a Dr too.  Most of the time I was able to work with ppl in the float pool so we could talk because we knew what was going on

Store atmosphere is set by the manager. My store. Current long time employees have said they have seen better managers than the one now in control. We have a micro manager who has stripped department heads of decision making powers.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
This is a good place to work for, for a short amount of time the management was not that good in both departments. Many people would go and come people didn’t like to stay because of management.
A really nice over all place to work.
great company to work for. good benefits. nation wide company with great management. I real work experience with a lot of potential. I recommend anybody to work for Safeway, they helped me a lot.
was my first job as a teen and I enjoyed it. Better then working at fast food. Was a simply job and fun. Started as courtesy clerk and then worked in the bakery department.
My review about Safeway is a good 1st job experience.  It was my 1st time working in a different state. Safeway is people friendly , very professional.
My time with Safeway was productive in that I learned people skills and the pay was good at the time. It was a good job for putting myself through college.
Cashier/Customer Service

I worked for Safeway. I worked in the Starbucks kiosk for most of the starting and then was offered by management 40 hours. They offered an ask if i would like to work deli starting and end shift in at the kiosk. Theirs a career you can start with Safeway.

Working at Safeway taught me a lot. I am working toward my goal by learning patience at my job to prosper my dreams in the future. I like learning new things & opportunities. Overall I thank safeway for hiring me .

This was a great job as I worked for Safeway in the 80s this was a great addition for my resume, I worked as in-house security/undercover this job was shoplift only no Internal investigations, also worked a large area from Fresno, Clovis, Visalia to Merced.
The disrespectful management, discrimination, favoritism that shows through scheduling, the hours constantly being cut, the 20 plus things expected to be done within a 5 hour shift.
My supervisor is an immature total control freak and hypocrite. I am assigned fewer days than those who were hired after me. I was sent home for having taken off my face mask to get a drink of water.

Over all I believe the management and employees of Safeway are doing the best they can because most complaints I have are more on the corperate end. For being "essential" and the back bone of smaller communities the company does little if anything to help their employees. Raises are very hard to get even if you've workered for the company for years and it seems that the company as a whole is quite unorganized. It's a great stepping stone but I personally could never consider it a career. Good healthcare if it's what you're working for.

Lots of friendliness, but turns into high school. The workers been there for 20 yrs. and more. They say one thing, then change their minds and says another thing. Lots of miscommunication and lack of communication. Gets confusing at times because even the managers doesn’t know what’s going on. The ones that’s been there for 20 yrs. and more tries to act younger than a teenager  sometimes. Lots of favoritism from management and lots of kissing derrières. I’ve seen workers come and go easily, and told that managers can’t make up their minds.
Very nice people but they got angry if you were standing still not doing anything. You couldn't take time off. Needed to be doing something at all times
It’s a great place to interact with your community. You get to learn many things about people and form new connections. They are flexible about scheduling as long as you ask beforehand!

The plus side is that unless you're caught stealing, there's almost no reason you will be fired from this company. I've had co-workers come to work hours late and leave hours early on a nearly weekly basis and never be fired. The work itself doesn't tend to be too difficult and can absolutely be accomplished if you have a decent team. Management is an absolute joke, though. My first department manager regularly made degrading sexist jokes (with customers, too) and racist comments - then got promoted up into HR. My current department manager gets 5 coffees a day, stands to the side of the kiosk on her phone directly outside of the kiosk talking to other employees or friends while I'm dealing with a rush alone, and then spends hours in the back either on her phone or talking when her tasks should take one hour at the most. Store management is aware and is "working to address the issues", but this has been going on for nearly a year so I don't have much hope. It's a really good job if you're just looking to make some cash while you go to school or something, but the work environment management creates is so terrible that I would never choose this job as my livelihood. You'll just end up miserable and feeling like you have no out because hey, bills have to be paid, right?

I only worked here for a short time in the deli. Its pretty busy but if you are good at customer service this will not be a difficult job. Most of the customers were nice as well. My supervisor and manager were very helpful during my training and showed their appreciation for my work.
I spent 13 years with this company. I’ve seen hundreds of people come and go. And like any other Fortune 500 company, your just a number.  This company could careless about your or your family.

Despite the rather stale environment I was working in, it was the people that I was working with that kept me going. A few of the people I worked with were around my age and I could easily converse with. Most of the older folk there were also nice and supportive. Despite the constant disarray at the workplace due to a lack of efficient management, everything seemed to always work out in the end.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Management only helps when someone is about to quit. I haven’t once seen them do anything reacting to a deli manager taking out her frustration on her team. It disappoints me that is allowed to happen in any way shape or form.

Safeway was the first job I ever worked at and it taught me a lot about customer service and how to engage with customers. Work environment was alright, my schedule was all over the place and changed every week so it was hard to plan for events and school. The pay was not worth dealing with rude customers.

In the beginning the manager said school is important and they are flexible with my schedule.  I barely get 3 days of 5 hours and when I'm at my check stand I cant talk to any coworkers. I have to be quiet and I get yelled at when I ask about my schedule for example I called last week because it was a 6am to 2pm on a Friday when I have a class, from 8am to 4pm, my manager yelled at me and said I picked the days when I clearly didnt and made a big deal about it.  I've told her my schedule multiple times and she still doesn't remember. Honestly I feel like she doesn't even care.
Safeway in Chelan is the dirtiest, grossest grocery store I have EVER been to the management just doesn't care. The store itself is dirty and the break room upstairs is covered in insects.
I love most of my coworkers and management, unfortunately we are being asked to do more with less time all the time without the compensation to reflect that in my opinion.
Worked off and on for 3-4 years, always been a good job, you get to meet new people every day and get work experience for other grocery stores. It’s a good job to get paid weekly.
My co-workers where my only solace, i was overworked, underpaid, mocked and threatened by management and district manager The only con was that we got to have Thanksgiving and Xmas potluck.

They are flexible with hours, especially if you are in school. You also get all of your requested days off. Most of the managers are nice and easygoing unless you slack off. They always make sure you get your scheduled breaks and lunch. Depending on the department, the environment is very chill and welcoming. Overall a fun and easy place to work.

Production is key, a lot of little jobs within the scope of every days work assembly/requirements  Customer service oriented, Busy enough to make the shift go by quickly, which I liked.  Nice people to work with.  I felt bad for the customer when the product they needed was not available.  I liked the evening closing schedule.
Affordable deals every week, friendly attitudes, easy product locations, sanitized environment, fresh varieties, helpful guidance, employee discounts, and more!
I think the job is great but it the Employees in the store convince to leave because they didn’t take their job seriously and made feel I did all the work and held the store down.

This company and the CEO are distressing along with the managers. I have seen over and over the treatment of new workers by the seasoned workers you have a high turnover along with poor treatment of new workers. I have seen hard working people just quit because the favoritism is to much. It seems that the CEO could give a concern about the high turnover rate in your store. It is not a fun place to work at all.

I have never worked for a company and store mgr. and been treated so unfairly and rude. I don’t think the store mgr. know compassion. I have continually worked hard for this company and it customers, but working in this environment cause me to have a stress break, and even then still no compassion form anyone who works there. I a great worker, my boss wants to fire me for unimportant reasons. Thank god, I have a union to back me up.
● Overall
It's really hard to find a good quality Safeway with proactive and trustworthy managers who  truly support their team! But you can get promoted quickly!

Never got support from upper management, got yelled at put down by Dept management. Store manager has no clue to what’s going on, he would rather ask for a resignation rather than deal with the real problem. Asking someone to resign from a position and go to another Dept instead of fixing the problem at hand. Very sad that I wasted almost 2 years of my life thwre

I was worngfuly accused of things and put on unpaid leave. Took a temporary job for money and decided to take it on full time. When I was called back to safeway and told all allegations were found false, dropped and asked to come back to work I stated that I will take on full-time. Weeks later I was told my name was put under do not hire based on a no call no show then do not hire based off job abandonedment. I was one of four people in the store able to work all departments and worked fine with everyone. Because two managers hire up in the store did not want me there they had two employees make false allocations in order to fire me. Once again they were found false by HR after an unpaid leave. I was always on time, always dependable and always professional. I ask that my reputation be replaced in order to reflect that!
I was bullying into quite because I found mold and other problems, and reported them to the store manager. The head backer also was not practicing safe work place skills
Everyday people are happy to be there, the management is always pushing to strive for a better store, the employees care about their job it’s an overall great experience to work there.

It starts out lovely! My co workers were all so friendly and kind..the lead decorator soon started to show their side. They were two faced depending if you screwed up, it not worth the stress and anxiety. You need connections within to be able to stay there.. The managers all have favorites and will put the work on someone else not caring whether you had time or not. If you want to become a successful cake decorator beware of the lead decorator breathing down your back.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

was a pretty basic night shift stocking job. Paid alright for what it was I guess, hours were alright, management was distant and uninvolved, high expectation of productivity in terms of speed. Short breaks. No benefits.
If you have a regular clerk position you'll probably be fine. Your manager will define your experience with this company, whether it be a great experience or an absolute nightmare.
I enjoyed the pleasant attitude of my co-workers. Friendly environment for learning new experiences. It was an overall positive experience and helped me improve my skills further.

Safeway was an easy going some what stress free worlk environment.  Management was there when you needed them. I had 6 weeks a year for time off and 2 weeks for personal or sick usage. Overall the company treats you fair
fun to see progress towards making our community want to shop with us. Good people to work with and most everyone enjoys the fast pace of the grocery store.

This job was okay at first. Then the night crew grocery manager started going out of her way to constantly harass me and almost sabotage me. The final straw was the disgusting false rumors she was making about me. In reality I had a death in the family and had to miss a day but I hope one day she changes. The way she treated people of color was extremely disgusting as well.
● Work-life balance

I worked at Safeway during the COVID-19 pandemic. Employees followed state and county regulations to keep customers safe. My experience at Safeway was positive. I received a raise after a short period of time working there. However, many employees complained.

The company is no longer what it used to be. They don't appreciate their employees. Or their well being or their health. The work load is heavy. They won't train you correctly they expect a computer to train you. They don't promote within. They rather allow someone outside that does not care to come in and run a store. Seasoned senior employees know more than highly paid salary individuals. But it isn't about what you know its about who you know and numbers. You can care and have ideas. But if it isn't controlled by an algorithm it doesn't matter. The bolts and screws of the company is old. With no hopes of stepping into the future. They can't keep department managers or staff.. They want you to put in your 2weeks notice for respect of the business, but if you are terminated (not for any loss to the company's assets) they don't give you 2 weeks. You'll be lucky to get your accumulated time in a timely manner. There is a bunch of grey areas that YOU have to figure out. While not having enough staff again your work load is heavy and so is the paperwork. They have a no cell phone policy yet individuals will take pictures and send them to you while on and off the clock. And then include you in group chats just to harass you on your off days. And the cliques don't get me started with those. You have store managers that talk down to their employees so bad that the employees are afraid to speak up. And these store managers are protected even though they twist the truth to their higher superiors and fix it so that previous employees can not come back. Are you going to college forget

My position wasn't set, each day I was expected to do something different from what I did the last day, and sometimes I would be told last minute to stop what I was doing and do something different and each week I would work different hours, sometimes even less than 20 hours a week. The managers weren't very good at communicating and sometimes even get into arguments with eachother. I wasn't making much money and most days didn't feel as though I was appreciated.

I have never worked somewhere so draining. I feel like my life and yours, is not valued at all, which is clear by how they've handled the pandemic. They are more worried about losing money, its always been about that. 4 people in my department  have left because of COVID-19. I’m pregnant so I worried if this would be worth the minimum wage pay, and so did my coworkers. The response from management was irresponsible and just a way for them to ignore the issue. They had us sign a contract that says we cannot work if we have been tested, even though the only people we've been in contact with is our coworkers and many of us cant afford to do that. Instead we just haven't gotten tested and hoped we aren't hurting anyone else. Im working overtime every week and my boss says it isn’t enough, I didn't think it would be so difficult to work like this but being pregnant is no joke. I feel unappreciated and like i've been taken advantage of.
The job was rather lackadaisical with a constant flow of day-in and day-out customers. I was given my store clerk duties and worked their at every present moment I could.

At start there was 3 AWESOME LADIES in charge of this program. Once they were reassigned it went down hill !! Shoppers didn’t complete customers orders, theft before items put on truck, lack of supervisors support,harassment and overwhelming favoritism !!
I would never work for this sexist company. Worst experience on a job ever.  quit without any notice and ran as fast as I could away from this company
its a treat when I get to help the customer find what they want and have good conversations. they always love to come back and ask for me to help them and that is the best feeling.
If something came up unexpectedly I could get the time off quickly and easily, never had a problem with scheduling. I had no problem with the job in any way, it was great.

Safeway used to be just an OKAY place to work. Since ALBERTSONS took over it sucks... they cut hours and staff because their sales are down, and what happens when you cut staff? The customers suffer and the workers suffer by having to deal with more work. The ONLY good thing about working here is the health insurance, it is cheap and it is okay insurance.
My job was good while it lasted I wish I could have stayed but I got shorted my hours because of the pandemic. My job was fair when I first started off.

Safeway has room to grow and move up in the company as long as you are dedicated and hard working. Safeway maintains a high standard and expects it employees to as well. We are throughly trained for almost any situation that may occur.

I was with safeway for almost 5 years. Met some of the best and worst people there. Depending on union/nonunion, if you ask for any days off they’ll only give you 40 hours. Management overall will hardly help out, and expect unrealistic expectations. Favoritism is definitely a huge thing, especially at the Dillon Safeway. I’ve seen great employees quit or talk about how they hate working there because they’ll favor someone who doesn’t do their job at all. Just be careful and don’t take any smack - but at the same time you’ll not be treated fairly.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Forget this place and run. Management is horrible and play favoritism.Very unfair.  Employees are treated very badly if you're not a favorite even if you're  a good worker.Over worked and under played, doing 2 to 3 people's jobs every day.

Don't do it. It's so corporate they dont care about anything but money. You will work Thanksgiving and Christmas along with all of the other holidays. They close stores and lay off 20 plus year employees. No employee appreciation what so ever
I’m on the front line and make minimum wage this job is Worth it I’d rather do something better...Customers yelling your face management does not back you up

Work schedule is flexible but they pay very low rate. I worked very hard for my position as a cashier but they never consider a better raise than what is printed in the handbook ($.50/year), unless you have to tell the store manager/ department manager that they have to pay you better. Management is terrible - when it's busy they have you clock out at the scheduled time and stay longer to finish the work unpaid. It's a good place to practice customer service skills, though.
My only issue is that they do not allow us to have water in our work area. I believe during the summer heat stroke or dehydration should be more of a concern.

It was a great place to work. I had the opportunity straight out of the military and if I didn't have to move back to Florida I would have stayed employed there. Great staff and atmosphere for anyone to walk into.

I was hurt while working, reported it to my supervisor. Instead of taking me into the office immediately, she went home. The following day I told her once again and was told it's past 24 hours, we can't report it.
● Work-life balance

Cutbacks have been a disappointment but enjoy the position. I enjoy the position as it is less stressful than a freestanding drugstore environment. Rural pharmacy practice is more personal and more satisfying.
I love working there everyone is like one big family always helping and supporting everyone! Everyone is very hardworking and makes sure that every customer is satisfied.
A job that is for young men and women to experience a high intense job that you can learn to gain good communication skills, cleanliness, and work ethic.

Safeway is a great company especially if you want to move up and further your career. They have great benefits and excellent Job security also local 400 is awesome with helping you with situation that happen in life. I love Safeway and the respect I have for myself I show that to my customer so that they have a great experience when they come in and shop their. It's all about them at the end of the day.

It wasn't more than I could manage. It's what you would expect working as a cashier in a grocery store. The manager was nice. When I had trouble working with the computer he helped me out. The customers weren't too bad actually.

Managers and store director need all of help! Very unprofessional and lack communication. Hired with one day a week unavailable but store director forgets and doesn’t honor your availability and schedules and makes you commit to working outside of your availability.
I have been at Safeway for 4 years and I have had good and bad experiences working there. It is fast pace, fun, and always something to do. What I love about it is meeting new people everyday.
● Work-life balance

The job itself was very easy. Crazy customers who can not read or argue with you over things corporate controls is what makes the job hard. Having managers who do not support you and keep with company policy is what makes this job almost impossible.
Great management team. So much loyalty from employees and management. Room for advancement. Decent pay and amazing Union benefits!

They had good working employees but some some didn’t do there job. They didn’t give people the hours they asked for. Pushing the carts was very hard, especially up a big hill. And dealing with the bottle machine is gross and stressful.
Too much favoritism. Makes it hard to.get hours pay rate is unfair..
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

I loved my job at Safeway when I worked for the Dublin store, but then I transferred to a store in Sacramento and the manager here is very unprofessional, unreliable, and he doesn't keep his word! It's been almost 2 weeks and I'm still waiting for him to give me a start date! I shouldn't have to call more than once about a job I already have, I should just be given a start date and that's it. I have a child to care for and bills to pay

I’ve been here a year.  I am exactly where I started.  No hope of going further.  Management in the dot com dept is poor.  Substandard equipment and trucks. Little or no support from management.  Have to fight other departments to get my job done.  Most days I arrive at work already set up for failure.  $afeway is just a money machine worried about bottom line then employees satisfaction safety and Heath.  Oh and apparently there’s a union but they don’t help either.  Not a place to work if you have integrity and a solid work ethic.

It’s a good work Place Everyone Work as a team all the time They make sure your safe and okay keep u energy on a good level I learn so much things Things I didn’t even know I could do my mangers are Very hard workers

When you're "getting trained", they only train you for maybe two days and then expect you to know what you're doing. The management as well as trainers treat you as if you aren't a good employee when you make one little mistake.
