Aside from training, the people also claim to be very professional, especially when it comes to certain situations involving customers, but when a fellow employee messes up even a minor thing, they get pulled aside in front of everyone. I felt as if I didn't really learn anything from working here. There's nothing enjoyable about working here, it's just more and more stress not to mention poor treatment of other employees.

From what I saw when working everyone has different experiences. Depending on how the store is store is run, it's a good job or a horrible job.  I didn't hate the job, but I wouldn't go back after leaving. Management is not concerned about the employees.  They don't always give someone to cover the mantory breaks unless it's for front end employees. Front end gets better treatment when it comes to breaks.  The stores almost want to create competition by the seniority in hours,but when someone ask for less hours (do to school) they don't care  and department managers will schedule employee how they see fit.  Asking for time off is a nightmare too.  Don't get to attach to any one person because it's revolving door for employees. A lot of employees come and go. As I said every Safeway will be different since there's no consistency between managers and stores.
Don't go there. Everyone practically is part time. A lot of nepotism and favoritism. Poor supervision. They tire out the good workers and play with the nepotism favorites.

I became assistant manager for the Jomba Juice stand with in the store. I stocked, inventoried, food prep, served in the deli, customer service, answered phones, managed schedules, and trained new hires.

It’s a good way for someone who has no job experience and needs some to get some but to work with the people and environment it’s not worth it. There is absolutely no privacy and no respect in the matter and it’s overall a toxic place to work. If you were to call in and tell them a private reason the whole store would know by the end of the day and also there is major favoritism and if your not liked by a person above you the you can forget about hours and the respect you deserve.
Had lots of fun everyday, maybe too laid back of a place, but alright pay. Didn't want to fire bad employees though. My front end managers were awesome.

So many management changes in the last 3 years. Coders are not recognized for having and maintaining your credentials. Pay is the same no matter the specialty. The easiest Primary Care non certified coders are paid the same as certified specialized coders in Surgery and Trauma. Doesn’t make any sense. It’s who you know and not what you know!
I enjoyed working with the people there and learn g new things, at times it was stressful on hollidays when the store was completely full but that is expected

Store is always under staffed, 2 people on the front end checking (on peak usually) and thats just the front end. Union/benefits are decent but for the lack of coverage, unless youre capped pay, work isnt worth it

This is the worst job on earth! They paid me 300$ for a 60 hr week cuz my store director hates me.. union did nothing! The deli manager was the best person on earth And that’s why I’m still here..also cuz I can’t find work anywhere else. You don’t get benefits till two years in!!! I started this job with 3,000$ savings..(.and I don’t buy things for my self) and now I’m 1,000$ in debt .. cuz ... how can you live on 800$ a month

Have had work for the company for 15 yrs . 10 of them had work for overnite shifts . Always asked to move to mornings shifts or afternoon shifts .. and never happend .always shirt hand it .just myself in the store stocking and makings orders .have to quit because of strees and company no willing to get extra emplooyes
I worked there for awhile, not a bad workplace. But management is unorganized and short tempered with staff.  The co workers are great, really good people.
All you have to do it just come in with a positive attitude and just continue to focus and stay positive. Overall my time with the company was good I have nothing bad to say.

If you’re looking to apply to the King City Safeway, do yourself a huge favor and don’t waste your time. This company is not concerned with the success and well being of its employees - in fact quite the opposite. Management is shifty, dismissive and full of empty promises, they say one thing and do another with or without formal notice. Be sure you get EVERYTHING written down, Management frequently “was never present in that situation” “don’t recall what you’re talking about” “never said that...” Basically on their end, it never happened. Harassment and bullying is quite common here, but forget about having HR and Management deal with these problems, all you’ll get is “I don’t deal with drama, I just sell groceries” and have no knowledge or practice of policy and procedure. I worked for this company for 4 years and it’s truly the most toxic work environment I’ve ever been in. Every week you will fight for hours, fight for a pay raise, fight for respect, fight for proper training, fight for PPE, and fight to be paid correctly on your weekly stubs. I was so hopeful for a successful experience at Safeway but it was the most stressful situation I’ve ever encountered. If you respect yourself enough, look for better work, I promise you it’s out there. You are so worth it!
Great place to work in overall good people to work with. The management was poor .i loved the people I worked with mostly and the customers where great.
Place is extremely toxic and metric driven but pay is great. The particular DPM slaves people which is typical of most Indians anyways. He throws people under the bus and makes people fear him

Safeway has a good work environment and has clear descriptions on the weight each person carries. Although every person had clear objectives, there was never enough people to satisfy the needs of the store and the costumers in a timely manner.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
I found working at Safeway to be an overall okay experience. Its any typical customer service job with wonky hours. I wished the hours were better as well as the pay.

In arizona it was anything like vons in California were they pay 14-18 bucks an hour. Northern arizona they paid like that. Washington Oregon it was a decent job as well. In phoenix Scottsdale area. They want every cent out of you. They work every penny out of you and only pay the least they can. Box truck driving isn't worth it. Part time? Minimum wage ? To check the oil level in a truck? Other companies like Macdonald's and jiffy lube valvoline will pay more for less work. Part time truck driving and they want you to drive far and dont work you close to home. Same as the store. I worked in a store in Scottsdale and they always promised to move me closer to home and never didn't. They wouldn't and couldn't find a replacement to move me and others closer to home. They didn't pay enough money for all the work they asked. They didn't treat anyone fairly. They manager they picked over me had no idea what they were doing. They had no experience and I over qualified for their job. And they didn't pick me. They don't pay enough and it shows. They run their team ragged while a manager just gets paid to chill..worst job ever. In other places they paid workers a livable wage. In Phoenix and Scottsdale they don't pay anything..
Safeway seems to be a family buisness and has a lot of friendly faces coming through, they are very competitive and always want to push themselves to be the best!

I worked in deli. It is a very high stress enviroment. The pay is minimal for the amount of work that is asked for minimal amount of personnel. High stress and not enough time to get it all done. Makes it frustrating to work and feel accomplished.
Overall great company to work for. Greatest attitude overall. Every section had a way of doing things and running to Safeway standards. other employees cross trained to help another section in need.
hard labor they don't appreciate the hard work .the union dont help.u are mandatory to work the weekends.wont give you time off.the work is not worth the pay
There’s not much I can say about the company. Very fast paced, have to have good work ethic. Once you know a lot of positions they expect a lot from you.

Not a bad place for young teens, union was a major perk, the staff became like my second family and work was my second home. I worked there for 2 years and I learned a lot about growing up, repsonsibilities, and being part of the workforce.

Whether you are a stocker, cashier, bagger, etc, you are constantly asked questions by customers. This gives you a pressure of putting a smile on your face all day and feeling exhausted from it when you go home.

The motto “Courtesy, Dignity and Respect” is what they state but not what they do. My people were great but my boss and a few people who stomp on you to get ahead were awful. I was humiliated, harassed, bullied and backstabbed on a daily basis. I ended up on medication.

In the entire Three years of me working for this company I learned how to interact with a very Diverse amount of people. the People that came to me asking for my help, spoke many Diverse languages that I didn't understand. But I did my best to understand them and help them.
Didn’t like it at all. I hated it. I was stuck with nothing but closing shifts. Never received real training and was told I was hired to be full time but was let go after holiday season
I like working for Safeway but they don’t pay good for the amount of work you do. They should look at that and make sure one of the important people of the company get pay better.

I have worked at Safeway for about 2 years as a courtesy clerk. For the past 5 months I’ve been in different departments as well. The managers are very good at making sure each employee is working in a department that suits their strong point and skills. Very cooperative with strict time schedules, they work with you around school hours, and understand when life happens and you need to call in.

I have worked for Safeway for 20 years. The best part about the job is that there are normally good people working there with you. The hardest part is the lack of help and your supposed to do it all without support. Then you are likely to get blamed for the things you might not get finished. This is why it has it's stresses and everyone feels it.

The management at this Safeway was the worst! Somehow having a management position made you feel very powerful while your employees are treated badly.  My supervisor was the worst when it came to training and then to listen and watch her behavior with customers was an embarrassment. I not only quit my job there I no longer shop there.

I worked for Safeway for a year and a half and worked very hard at my job. I enjoyed it, there were struggles, but struggles come with all jobs. I had great coworkers and my manager helped me with my struggles.

I never minded the job personally. I worked in the produce department and the only real issue I had was the disconnect between us the workers and the corporate/ management teams. We're expected to live up to these expectations and get chewed out when we don't meet them or we do meet them but still get chewed out because it wasn't "their way".
You will never get support from anyone or anywhere in Safeway. They are mentally and verbally abusive. There is entirely too much gossiping and intimate relationships within the company.
Over the past 10 years Safeway has treated me really well as an employee. Unfortunately there's not much room for growth and very little job security.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

I enjoy working at chi but my until has been closed off and on for a year and I have had to float most days.  I feel co workers satisfaction is down in general but everyone is trying to maintain a sense of happiness.
My experience was diminished by the lack of management skills at this particular store  Overall staff morale was low  Store was reportedly slated for closing
In the four years I've been with the company there have been a number of ups and downs but overall it is a great first job but not a career one should pursue.

It was a typical job for a high school student, that gave insight on the workplace for future employment and allowing for people to go higher in the chain. The people that worked their were nice and good at allocating times that fit into your schedule.

Safeway is a great place to work for a few years. The pay is reliable and good for earning a bit on the side. Your schedule is sporadic, meaning you could lock-in at 6 am on one day, but 4 pm the next day.

Happy, exciting, meaningful fellow employees and managers. Many hardworking, caring people trying to help our customers any way we can in our community. I love being a part of such a vast group of employees that enjoy what  we are doing for our customers, their, our families and community.
They scheduling was bad. Only 8 hours off between shifts. Poor management and leadership. Poor training and they overwork there employees that's  all I  can think  for right  now

The only long timers there were there before current management.   They won't leave because they're all close to retirement and are still getting pre union benefits. The current management doesn't know how to treat people and the turnover rate shows it.

Safeway is a good company towards beginners who are looking for their first job. It’s quite easy to go through the flow of working though you will be asked to do other things outside what you’re applied for. While not a bad thing, you end up learning a bit more about the store itself.
Las personas que trabajan aca, tratan a los empleados como basura, los manager de los cuartos y lideres de linea, son personas sin educacion, ni respeto por los demas.
Terrible management and no advancement or pay raises, good workplace overall everyone was nice but management needs to change especially with the sanitation department
Safeway was a great place to work , good benefits . A lot of different opportunities, to grow your with the skills you have also , flexible with school schedules .
I spent long enough here to know that it is a great company to work for. From starting as a high school student to working my way up to a career, i never had any problems.

In general, it is pretty fast paced. There is rarely not something to do. However, when you run out of things to do, youre pretty much sol. Can get extremely boring or be extremely stressful. There's no inbetween.
Might not occur at other locations but the store i work at has poor management, does not pay fairly for those who work management positions, store director plays favorites

They are very thoughtful towards people that have disabilities. Management is very kind towards employees other coworkers are thoughtful of others the good work environment and it's encouraging. And you will learn a lot about retail and how it runs with Safeway.

If you want to be talked down to, this is the place to go. They hire managers from slow stores and put them in busy stores so that they will cut the hours of all the employees making it virtually impossible to finish a task. Consistently getting called to check when you're trying to finish never finish a task because you only had one cashier

It was a good enough job to pay the bills. The management was slightly below average in my opinion. They really didn't seem to listen to ideas or issues unless they viewed it as important to them, which lead to a lot of frustration. It felt like you were just another employee, a body to put in production or whatever job they needed you to serve. It was difficult to get time off, schedules can be brutal (swing to morning, morning to grave, grave to swing sometimes). The pay was great for the work I was doing, but the work/life balance was non-existent for years.

SAFEWAY INC. was strick percise on store policies. Management co UK ld improve employees worked well as a team. Shelves were nice neat readable if an item was sold out they would recommend a rebate. The prices could be better especially sale prices. Overall SAFEWAY INC. is a good place to shop.
Great place to work and move upwards. Had lots of help from different departments in order to succeed in my roll. Loved the work environment and coworkers.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
Great first job learned a lot about talking to customers and Really excelled when I worked in the Star Bucks Kiosk Was lots of fun would work here again.

I really enjoy most of the employees I work with for the most part but the management had obvious favoriyes. As a new worker you realize that nobody trains you properly they expect you to do ur job 100% complete without even properly training you for the job. Management is rude to the crew whenever it gets super busy. My hiring manager doesn't encourage anyone who's struggling and would go out of her way to tell that employees how bad they're doing instead of helping out. In my experience there... I would have to say its not a workplace I enjoy going to everyday. Strong 4-10
No training, union job with lazy union workers expecting non union workers trying to get in to do most of the menial jobs. High union dues, never again.
I had a lot of friends I worked with, but got tired of customer service. Work environment was good. There was room for growth and I had a lot of fun for the most part

There are a lot of nice employees but a lot of the management is horrible. They play favorites, really don't care about most of the workers, and the pay is offensive. However, it's not a hard job at all.

A typical day at work is filled with constant things to get done. I have an ice case to set. Food safety to prepare for. Orders to maintain. Deadlines to meet. Customers to serve. Monthly inventory organization is important. I have learned how to handle a lot under pressure but find that I enjoy the challenges.
The Livermore store has a manager that only likes certain people and if you aren't one of them he will give you he'll.  Some of the individual department managers are good.

While the job offered some flexibility and lenience with scheduling, most of the benefits were not very apparent. Once you learned your job duties you come and get what you need done and not much more. Often you will find yourself either busy with monotonous work or finding that there isn't enough work, depending on day and location. It was an okay job overall, and I spent about 2 years as a cashier, 3 total. I wouldn't say it was unbearable but after a while you may find yourself bored if you are constantly looking for advancement or new opportunities for work tasks.
Great place to work. Management is fair and thoughtful.  Co workers are supportive and caring.  More available hours would make it a better place to work.
Safeway is a good start out job. The company is not what it use to be. Management has gone down hill. Almost every day someone calls in sick and nothing happens to them.

I would recommend not working here because the management is terrible and they are in their office talking and eating all day. They make the cashiers and courtesy clerks do all the work. The scheduling is very bad you don’t have set anything (day off, days on) it changes every week and they only post 1 work week at a time.

I didn’t think my over all time at Safeway was bad. There were some mangers I may have not agreed with, but I was still able to get along with them. I had to quit for personal reasons during the whole ongoing COVID-19 mess.
I love my work family. Every one there are great workers and we all get along. To me it reminds me of a little work house hold.
Awesome District manager versal Excellent company work for always room for improvementI Been in the Businessover 35 years love everything about retail
Fun job , nice people. Becomes more like family after a while. Everyone enjoys seeing familiar faces and learn names quickly .safeway gave me a shot and I enjoy going to work everyday
I do not recommend Safeway to the people that want to work there for years due to the fact of their new contract. They don't get paid well it's a good job to have for a few months ONLY.

I only worked here for two months and it had to be one of the worst jobs I've had. If you're hired to be a courtesy clerk, the management treats you horribly and the turnover rate is high. You're hardly given any hours and worked like a slave when you are there. You're constantly being watched by management in your every move and you'll get yelled at if you're caught doing anything wrong even if that's what you were trained to do, and they make it extremely obvious that they're watching you constantly. As courtesy clerks, we weren't given a pay increase like everyone else during the pandemic, even though we our putting our health at risk just as much. Don't work here unless you want to be treated like dirt while being paid minimum wage.
Did not like the job, more so the staff. I had a good few days until you start to see the mistreatment and violation of federal health standards. Thats that. I quit.
Very good management and employees.  They are all friendly and patient with new hires. I am treated like I  belong there. The job is easy to learn.  Employees are always  happy

As a seafood clerk, all I did was pull frozen shrimp off the shelves, thaw them out, and put them into the display cases... for the same price. The only purposeful part of my job was occasionally steaming shrimp for people. The quality of products is minimal and nothing is actually fresh. Everyone comes to buy our shrimp salad but it’s not special, literally look up “old bay shrimp salad” and it’s the same on google.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
Wazzup its cold. Good managers low pay. Wazzup yet g some help 👌 have donaldhopkinson100 gmail on paper HD some way back and blues up come Xfinity have

Safeway is a good company as a whole and everyone I worked was really nice but the hours I worked at night were horrible. The pay was not very good , and the training was not there, very unorganized, whe. Unloading the freight .

management could care less about you, they treat you like a slave, get upset when they don’t get what they want, and you’re guaranteed to always see them in a horrible, unsupportive mood. everyone is out for themselves, everyone. you can’t trust anyone (there are maybe a handful of good people who work there) and you won’t be able to have any benefits until you devote one year of your life to get paid time off, sick leave, and medical/dental insurance. if you are considering working at this Safeway in Payson, AZ, don’t waste your time... trust me
Love working there and even shopping there before I was even an employee. All employees love helping the customers through out the store. Always clean
Love working there they always keep everything clean and in order and workers are always willing to help someone out on the floor everything is always nice and always greeting you at the door
When I first started at this job it was OK it was enough money to get me by I was happy with it at first and I realize that I wasn’t getting paid enough for what I was doing, scrubbing human feces

Extremely hard work! Have to keep your percentage up & that is solely based on speed. You have to stack boxes/orders all day more than 10ft high, you have to do it fast and then pull the stack on top of a pallet jack in an environment with lots of traffic (moving forklifts, pallet jacks etc.) ... The norm is 4 days on 3 days off ... except it’s my 13th day working straight in a row. If they have to they will work you on your day off but at least they tell you in advance. They are trying to weed out people in the beginning so expect to be working an insane amount of overtime for 10-11hrs per day.

I was hired && then let go because of something on my background.  They claim I was hired mid February but due to poor management communication,  I wasn't brought in to work till late March. I was then asked to step down the beginning of April, claiming because of something on my background, I wasn't a good candidate for the position I currently held.   They also had agreed to do a wage match when I started, but never came through with it.  Paying me 5$ an hour less then what they had agreed to in the beginning.  No one is ever available to speak to && the ppl that i have spoke with are never knowledgeable about what to do.  I WILL NEVER WORK FOR THIS COMPANY OR AFFILIATES IN THE FUTURE.

Working for Safeway was a good experience overall. From the interview process to your first day on the job, you feel as if you are part of a team and that they want you to succeed just as much as you do.

I would give a big fat zero if I could not willing to work with my education share personal info and putting me on punishment duties no I feel ... Sanitation and closing bakery cleaning only forcing me to have to quit with min hours cannot feed my family and giving them to people who where hired after me...I hate safeway and the way the have been treating me

La compañia es bastante buena  hay buen ambiente de trabajo y de colaboracion .Sus beneficios y salarios son buenos y sobre todo oportunidades para crecer y hacer carrera si eres una persona que tiene ambicion y esta siempre con aptitud de aprender y crecer.
Safeway was a cool job I really enjoyed it. I was cross trained on 5 positions which was awesome because I enjoy being well rounded in all job positions.
customers were always harassing employees for stuff they couldn't control. Pay is not good unless you work there for 10+ years. Not enough staffing to meet the demands the store wanted.
I hope you're all aware that the same people bagging your groceries also take care of the bathrooms every other hour. There's no training on bagging groceries either.

Worked on deli with no set standards. Food safety and proper equipment cleaning and handling is not a priority. Asking management for help with unsupervised staff problems made me a target for two years. I left and notified the health department during Covid19 because the poor practices were going to get someone ill.

I love working at safeway. Management is always willing to help and it's a fun loving atmosphere. I learn new things daily and my direct supervisor works directly alongside the department to help anywhere that he is needed.
If you want to get your foot in the door with the work force then this is a good experience. It’s not the most challenging job but you learn how to deal with people.

The work was good but if you're not part of a clique then you are not accepted by others. It's not the store that's bad it's about 90% of the employees that gossip continuously about others but yet they don't look at themselves and see there horrendous flaws

My experience at Safeway was not a very enjoyable one. The management side wasn’t well. The store manager was not very understanding of most employees situation and it seem as if he did not want to be involved with some areas of the store. Some employees weren’t very pleasant to be around, and the store I worked at had favoritisms to certain employees.

I made some good friends working here, of all ages. The job can be stressful and thankless like many other minimum wage jobs. My branch often promoted people hired after me, you have to go after promotions because they do not promote simply based on how long you've worked there.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
I've been lied to several times by this company and they are always quick to pass the blame when it hits the fan. I've worked for worse retail but Safeway is as cheap as the rest of them.
Hardly any hours, they kept hiring more people for the same positions when there were no hours for employees already there. Management was terrible, very unprofessional

Ever since Albertsons bought out Safeway, it has turned worse and worse. Management is to complacent, expect more out of you that what you’re required to do, want you to do manager things that you’re not getting paid to do. District Managers have no clue what they are doing, (never have worked in the department that they are over watching.) And if you are not liked in whichever department you are in they will cut your hours to try and get you to quit.

It honestly is not a bad beginner job. But I would get 7 3/4 hour shifts sometimes and I wasn't aloud to take a lunch, just two 15 minute breaks, sometimes just one if it was super busy. Which was horrible because not only was I hot, hungry and tired. It didn't seem fair that other people with 8 hour shifts were getting lunch while I worked an equally long shift and got no lunch. It was kind of their loop hole. The front end manager was always down everybody's neck so it seemed like more people would slack off when she was there. It's kinda funny that more work would get done when she wasn't there. I do not recommend you get a job here...sorry

The work they want done buy 1 individual is ridiculous, the stress level is toxic. They say 1 thing and then another, as long as it fits their need at the time.  Most of us employees that have lasted as long as I have find it hilarious when they say they care.  I’m here to tell you that the only thing that matters is the bottom line and there is no dignity or respect.

Working at Safeway as a part time employee was a pretty decent experience. The employees there are nice and it is a great environment. Management were very rude at times with most of the employees there when I was working and would criticize them for not working up to their standards. They also gave no real training for new employees at the store with most of them just being put straight to work with no supervision.
The work at Safeway is harder than one would expect in either a physical or mental sense. However, the people around you in the workplace make it much easier to get through the work day.
At the lowest end of the chain, no serious complaints. Was not to difficult, few tasks, sometimes great scheduling, pay was more than fair, and did not feel threatened in any way.

A typical day at work went by pretty fast I am a sanitation lead so I cleaned carts I learned that you'll have nice and mean customers the management there was great everyone was very welcoming the hardest part about my job was having patience with cleaning carts the most enjoyable part of my job was seeing my coworkers.

I had some good times working at Safeway. I enjoyed a lot of the people I worked with too. There was at times some tension and difficulties but there are a decent amount of positives about working at Safeway. I thank the people that helped me but it wasn't the type of job for me, but still enjoyed working there sometimes.
The diversity of the company and how they take care of the customers and the willingness to help the customers and the desire to help their employees to fill their obligations.
This is most definitely not a career opportunity, the management sucks and it’s a serious lack of communication between management and employees especially in the bay point store 1215
Safe environment, hard to maintain a good wellness when working difficult hours. No reliability in income. Not ideal for starting a family but definitely a good first job.
Safeway is a wonderful place to work at.

Myself along with 70 other applicants worked as contractor's from May to December. We were hired right before Christmas. By the time Safeway was preparing to hire prospective employee's full-time, I have been acquainted with all individuals I would be working with.
I did not personally care for working as a barista but i di enjoy bagging however i was pregnant so pushing carts around was very difficult i liked the people working tere though very nice people

Safeway is a great starter job but its very physical and I personally feel like I don't belong there. They don't really give me weekends off and I would love to work everyday but I have things to do and appointments to get to, and having to ask for the day off is embarrassing for me, especially because it's my first job. They do try to work around your schedule but I feel like they get bothered because they have to look for someone to take over your shift. Overall I was liking Safeway for like the first week but now I come home tired of being in there an I'm only on my third week!
Fairly good at most times but can be stressful. Not the greatest management. Some workers just don’t show up, and the others have to take over their roles while doing their own.
nice people and friendly coworkers. good manager and supervisor. no other reason. they have low price food. clean environment and nice customers and a lot of stock too

As a first job, working the deli in a busy Safeway, it was one of the worst experiences of my life. I don't know how it is at other locations, but at mine it felt like I was nothing more than a drone in a consumerism fulled factory rather than a valued employee. Management was basically non-existent with training left to senior employees. And the long, grueling hours combined with a strict schedule, made for a rather miserable experience. There was even a point where another new hire and I were left to run the whole deli by ourselves for two hours with basically NO experience between us.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Hiring managers or human resources staff briefly review all applications looking for applicants who meet the minimum requirements outlined in the job posting. The goal of screening is to pare down the number of applications that receive a thorough review.
The rewards club helps a lot of regular customers find their own products while saving good money on food and prices, while developing rewards on gas & etc.

i worked for five months in Safeway Wheaton (Maryland) but I have never seen a company as racist as that one. harassment, lack of consideration, lie and many others on the part of managers. Until the day my child got sick and fired me. I warned Human Resources, but nothing. I recommend this company to no one because they are monsters who are there.

Honestly, this wasn't the worst job I've had but it wasn't the best either. The managment wasn't the best, their dynamic was very off. To be able to get a day off or report an issue you had to go through about 4 or so people before getting to the right person. They definitely need to choose their managment better.
I got hired to be curbside shopper at 12.20. Then got told I could stock at night for 12.70. But wasn't told NOT the full eight hours. Only prime time from 12 to 5..Yeah. I walked out after 3 days.

Not Enough Real Time Training On Checkstands No Reliable Trainer To Show Or Explain The Do's & Don'ts On Checkstand Guidelines. Showed No Effort To Trainee On How To Deal With Customers Information About The Store & It's Inventory. Absolutely No Concern About The Well Being Of An Safeway Employee Safety Work Environment.

They schedule you any and all holidays it is mandatory. The pay is horrible and when they offer you a position with a raise  the company does not follow through with the raise. Horrible benefits with no lifestyle scheduling.

I honestly enjoyed this job it was really easy and fun to me the only bad thing is, is the customers some of them are really rude for no reason and you can't control them so you just have to deal with it.

Training was good, well paced; coworkers very flexible and helpful; fairly easy to get additional hours when desired,  learned lots of new things; I was taught the importance of safety and cleaning due to sharp knives and slicers; loved the chicken wings in various flavors
You’ll get scheduled for days on end without a day off people are really fun to work with and the job isn’t too difficult definitely not a bad place to work

Starting from Corporate on down to store managers Safeway is just awful. They don't have any idea how to train people, so good luck on not sinking your first day. They treat their employees horribly. The pay scale is very very bad. Work hard for a year? Don't count on a raise. It is to bad but after Cerberus bought them it has just gone in the touket

Excellent safeway is a great investment  to work in and safe I really liked working in safeway the routine  schedule  we had made time go by quicklythats what I liked the most because I hate being  bored at work .

Horrible environment they want everyone to constantly be scared to lose their jobs . There is no loyalty in the company just a bunch of backstabbers. Nothing is ever good enough they never give positive feedback on anything just negativity all the time

This company is perfect if you like being treated poorly, overworked, guilted into working your days off or when sick, accused of theft, denied vacations, being bullied and harassed by department managers, with store directors turning a blind eye if one of their “Golden workers” happens to be one of those managers, having breaks taken away regularly, tricked into working a double shift and NOT receiving overtime pay for it with the excuse always being the employees fault for not clocking in or out, which leads me to, time clocking being altered for that reason or more commonly, so they can simply threaten a write up for being late, and, to top it all off, discriminated against racially and sexually. Now, many of you are thinking, “Safeway is a union job. Seems like something to take up with the union rep.” You are correct. Unfortunately, there are only a few reps and they can’t be everywhere, all the time, leaving many employees feeling ignored when serious issues arise.
Very awesome and nice people. Some thing could get better but that’s everywhere! Was treated fair as I did the same to others. Overall a great place to work!

depending on the location of the store would determine the amount of work and or stress you are taking on. as a courtesy clerk, whether it was pouring down rain or 100 degrees you are doing your job inside and out. you have to be able to handle rude people as well, be as nice and as welcoming as you can be, no excuses.
Personally I didn’t really like working here because the employees brought their problems to work I did learn how to handle money, cashier and it gave me more work experience.
Was a decent job it paid steady and had clear guidelines to keep me on track I did end up leaving due to a car accident and other aspects otherwise i might have stayed

It's exactly what you would expect from a job at a grocery store. For the most part work is okay, but micromanagement can be a huge problem. Here's few things you might not know. You do not get first day sick pay and need a doctors note to get 2nd day sick pay. I've been there three years and have been unable to ever use any of my sick pay. Most of the managers are great, but some of the higher-up managers are terrible, especially if you're not one of the favorites.
They have a seniority rules kind of thing but its good. They pay very well. Not only are they a customer first kind of job but they actually value the employees.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

The job was very interesting and very challenging but at the time it was a great position.  I was first a courtesy clerk, then promoted to E-Commerce.  I really enjoyed working that position, grocery shopping for customers
really good management. great work environment. more tech help than other retail company and better pay too. Felt less stressful than other retail companies.
Don’t do it  the manager constantly changed my schedule and called me in last minute cause she couldn’t set up schedules right  and we never had enough people working at any point
Management mostly supportive in store. Questionable support from upper management outside store level. I loved working in the floral department.  I would love another opportunity in floral design.

Thaey are a great company they give you oppertunity they understand even the most oit of the ordinary situations family orientated . they are willing to help whrn things get rough and not afraid to understand were youve been and were your trying to go

For me, Safeway wasn't very friendly towards me. The coworkers were very friendly, but management wasn't and fired me because they didn't think I was taking my job seriously, even though I was sick for a couple weeks
Working at Safeway was Strict and rewarding at the same time. The manager at the time was fair. The job was simple, get the food, and put it in a cart.

When I working in Safeway what I did was learn how to management my work time what I have to done when i work in Safeway. After I went home, I have to set up the next day what should i have to be done during the work.
It was not a good place to work. It was a disaster to work with them. I was let go because I was going through difficulty with my co-workers. I'm not working there anymore.
I loved my job here my manager Charlotte was amazing and most of the people I worked with took me in like family. They offer great advancement and training.
Employees are very hardworking and supportive. Most customers are easy to help and there's alot of cross-training between departments.
When i worked there, as a cashier, the manager there helps you out a lot with questions about ; what you can do for the customer and if needed, help checking because customers are waiting.
Good place to start working if you’re in school or are wanting to go. They work well with a school schedule and it’ll teach you a lot about the retail life.
I love this job, everyday we give good customer service and keep the place clean to customer standards,  the bad thing is most everyone is always late
This job is not exciting, engaging, or fun. I can't imagine doing this job for very long, much less as a career. After all, the grocery industry is known for its high turnover rate.

Safeway's Starbucks kiosk runs similarly to a standalone Starbucks store, but often does not have the means and materials to operate in a comparable way. The store I worked at did not have an oven for pastries, blonde roast, or a cold brew tap. Sometimes, you have to deal with snippy customers expecting the full Starbucks glitz and glam and their upset or rude attitude when you let them know what they desire is unavailable. Management was very nice, and mostly flexible as long as they're given notice about schedule conflicts. Pay is not great, but fair for the job — plus you can usually keep what little tips you gather during the shift.
They a great company to work for even if its your first job. Great learning experience to have. Great social skills as well and interacting with customers.

Don't apply. Smokescreen. No management support because they are normally just sitting at the desk looking out the window overlooking the store and not helping with customer service when the lines are too long.
Decent company to work for when it comes to retail. Pay was increased based on previous retail experience. Standard retail job that had more respect then fred meyer

I only left because I got cancer, I really loved this place so much everyone there was amazing, I wouldn't have left if I didn't have to. Managment was very caring and helped and worked around schedules if needed
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

For the most part it’s a decent place to work. However when management is under pressure they tend to stress out the staff. Once you finally say “No” that you can no longer work all day or take responsibility for multiple departments you are valued less and their temperament changes towards you changes

No opportunities to move up unless you know someone from the top, only connected people get a chance to move up. I have more management background than most, still they overlook if they do not like you....
Horrible place to work for . Management sucks  all they care about is the profit their making and nothing else. Once you have been there a certain amount of time they try anything to get rid of you
*The hardest part of the position is the manual work: lifting, bending, & moving products. It is what I liked as well because not just sitting around.
i,m sorry i really dont have much to say cuz this would be my first job so forgive me if this resume is a little messed up but i,m really trying to get this job so i can live my life and dreams

I worked as a bakery clerk. The bakery was always understaffed forcing you to do the work of 2-3 people on top of customer service. The manager is.. Less than friendly. Often berates and belittles you. The way she treated people would often run off new recruits. I had to move something heavy and asked for help, and was told to just figure it out. So I tried to move it and ended up getting hurt. Long story short before I was cleared from the doctor they tried to force me to go back. I value my health, so I quit immediately. I do not recommend Safeway.

The places isn’t a bad place to work but i much rather work at Taco Bell then there . Everyone thinks there better when there higher up and don’t treat other people good . Sometimes not even customers.

8-5 basic job. No after hours on-call or weekends required. Challenges each day with various issues mixed into the normal software development, testing. Great co-workers and a fantastic boss who looked out for his people. (Too bad he retired last month)

Being a cashier clerk at Safeway was fairly easy. But with the long shoes it went by fast being a cashier clerk because you seem groceries and put them in the bag all day it was a perfect job as a college student.

They don’t treat you like you are human. They will have you work crazy hard and not even say thank you or good job. All they care about is making money so they can bonus. They cut the stores hours back more and more and just pile more work on that staff that is there
In my 7 years with the company i have been treated well. It is a repetitive job where you can learn many skills. Getting along with co workers is easy, it is good to have supportive co workers.

I had a lot of fun working there. I learned ways to improve my customer service and made some new friends. People there are very nice and helpful. The only hard part was having to get carts in the heat. A typical days work would be going to get carts for shoppers, putting the grocery customers did not want back and collecting baskets, going and getting items customers forgot or could not find and doing a lottle cleaning.
It wasn't a bad place to work and for the most part I thoroughly enjoyed it there.

It was a good place to work until they cut hours and changed management all the time the staff was good to work with during my time with the company but other than that I will never work for them again
Cool job bad manager a lot of hard work trucks in bad shape make you work in bad weather with no heat and bald tires unorganized and, more they also showed favoritism

The work environment at Safe way if very friendly, everyone talks to everyone and is there for them when needed. All of my co workers make sure I am okay if I am having a bad day and do all they can to make me feel better
Focus on work, break rooms are rather dull, supervisors respect productivity and have employees earn their work hours by maintaining good attendance and having strong productivity

Safeway is where I grew both as a person and with my career within the company. I Established  life long friendships with customers keeping many on first name based for many customers.  THEY ALWAYS MANAGED TO HANDLE ANY CHANGES WITH SCHEDULE IN TIMELY  MATTER

Bagging groceries offering carryout cleaning restrooms then the five o'clock rush. Every customer has their preference and you have to deal with the public every day. You get your regular costumers every week for Friday sales. You'll see sometimes you are out of an item.

This was different than i have done. My co-workers were amazing. Management liked teaching me new things so i would able to advance in my career.  I learned how to manage all the booking skils. And my favorite was customer service. I made the best customers. Many times they just came in and sai Hi!
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
It was cool working their but the hours we’re getting cut. Not the best place if your looking for a first time retail experience. Enjoyed my time their.
Mico-management, no accountability for bad work, attendance, management new to position, poor communication with employees and supervisors. The company is relocating out of state.

There was definitely a standard at this establishment, but it was not in any way in favor of the employee. Safeway kept up a professional image but we were not able to express ourselves in any meaningful ways. No accessories, unnatural hair colors, and we could not wear business shirts.

If you want something to do this is it, but don't expect and appreciation for that work verbally or financially. Minimum wage starting then hopefully you can get an assistant management or maybe even a management position after 10+ years. They always are increasing the amount of work required and not giving you the people to help do that job. Got to a point that I couldn't take the mental harassment everyday of not getting a job done in the hours/employees given to accomplish that job.
Great service , just wish i had more hours and more of the pay rate . But friendly coworkers and customers . I hate leaving them but just wanted more hours

I left employment several years ago, but had a fairly positive experience.  The Director Pharmacy was outstanding, however the store general manager lowered my agreed hourly rate when I started and I had to repeatedly challenge him until I finally received the agreed upon wage.  This was years ago and he is no longer working for Safeway.  That was a bad initial representation of the company.  Thankfully my supervisor was outstanding and always delivered what he promised.

This company is the most disrespectful,  and anti employee company I've ever worked for! They don't care about tenured employees,  and they are just a horrible company.  I have worked with them for several years, and in this time they have terminated me, twice and countless others just to have to bring us back via arbitration.  If you have time invested in the company and is at top pay, they want to get rid of you as opposed to applauding your loyalty and hard work. NEVER EVER WORK FOR THIS COMPANY.
In this company there is no support and the union is a joke.  You have to fight for yourself if there is a problem or to save your job.

As a pharmacy manager I worked 11 hour shifts but had additional days off.  This is a schedule that I preferred.  I had an excellent staff and for the most part sufficient ancillary help to do the job.  Front end Management was also extremely supportive of the pharmacy.   I loved helping people and sharing my knowledge.

There's no tough love or accountability from the top echelons of the Safeway Management Hierarchy to the Courtesy Clerks ( the lowest level positions) resulting in lackluster results and low work ethic. In fact there's not much communication at all from upper management to the rest of the staff. There needs to be constant communication and accountability to facilitate a strong and cohesive working environment. I love conversing with the shoppers. The most difficult part of the job is getting people to care about their jobs  and preforming as though they do, regardless of their pay rate. Any place you work you should treat that workplace as though you own it. In this way you will expect the most from yourself and perform to the best of your ability as will the other employees.
Going to work with alot of motivation learning alot of generals skills with very respectful management and energetic workplace noting hard about my job . enjoy working..

On a daily basis, store is expected to be successfully stocked and faced in every department upon opening to meet customer satisfaction. Every department manager guides their colleagues to assure daily tasks are completed and their department is prepared. The work environment is not only welcoming and friendly amongst the customers but as well as with the employees.

i started as a deli clerk. wanted the brass ring, went for deli manager to pay the rent, and thought i would  be good at it. I ended up with the same pay as my top deli clerk, with 300% more duties. Asked for compensation, or allow me to move down to just a clerk, and was denied, for several years.  Safeway never cared about Me.

I found that most of mangament had favoritism against certain employees. While you got great benefits and options in hours.. hours would drop for no reason because new employees would cycle through the company. It was over all easy work experience for my first job. Just not pleasant with other employees and especially mangament that later a few months after quitting- got fired.

I really enjoyed working at Safeway. Safeway is one of the few companies who still allow asset protection to do what needs to be done in order to stop merchandise from just walking out the doors. I really respect that because it shows me that the company cares about its merchandise and the people who are working hard to keep the shelves stocked for honest/paying customers.
Great people you work with.Management and pay are very average which leads to uninspired and unenergetic employees.Very hard to change the culture and overall quality in the departments.

Great health benefits if you are in the union. If you are non-union, the health "benefits" are 1/3 of your wages, roughly. The people are generally nice to each other and to customers. Expect lies, corporate obstruction, keep a sharp eye on your paycheck by keeping a separate log book of your hours worked, and try not to be abused by being pulled in too many directions at once by management or fellow employees. You can make a career here and move into other departments if you so desire on occasion. Expect everyone to be playing on cellphones in the breakroom during their breaks.

The co-workers are nice but at the particular location I worked at the customers had a large sense of entitlement due to the fact that it was one of the more expensive grocery stores in the area. That made the job torture as the customers were rude and working in a grocery store is quite mundane as the tasks assigned for 2 hours were often done in fifteen minutes. This caused most of the shift time looking for things to do.
every day was always different and I got to meet a lot of great hard working people that I will always remember. I also learned a lot about how ro be friendly.

A great place to work, great benefits and job growth. Management gives you the tools to be successful and plenty of opportunities to grow with the company. I wholeheartedly recommend working at Safeway.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.
Good pay as a driver. Bad management in all departments. No loyalty with drivers. They have great tractors to drive and trailers. Must stay overnight on some trips.
safeway is a good company to work with they gave you the hours your available to work aside from that there under UNION with benefits and all... the store i used to work was 24 hours
The schedule is always changing so I can not plan weeks ahead at a time without missing out on work. The job is rather annoying but has good benefits and such to it.
Working for Safeway is joyful. They treat you like family. I remember when I first started I knew nothing and then I turned around had one of the best trainers and became a pro at my job

Safeway has a wide variety of positions, both in their stores and in their supply chain. I worked nights in the frozen food department. Can't say I enjoyed the Muzak, but we were permitted to listen to our own music on headphones. Management focused much more on my results than on my methods, providing me with more latitude, in that respect, than I've been given at any other job.
Everyone works together to get jobs done.  The management works with you to give you the best possible schedule to fit your needs.  It's a very nice work environment.
You get barely any help with this company. A thing called the sweep log holds you up a lot. They should give more breaks. They hire a lot of smokers. They are reluctant to change your position.
I enjoyed this place very much,  everyone became family. however i was very hurt emotionally  when i became sick and they were quick to give up on me.
I’ve worked at a lot of stores and at every store I learn something new, from operating procedures to merchandising.
Most of the managers are really nice . The other employees were nice to work with. The job  it self was really easy to pick up. They paid to train u and u can get over time in the paid training.
Working at safeway was only a positive experience due to my coworkers. They made the environment manageable. Wasn't very found of management. I only like my first boss when I was working there.

I have not been a member of this team long enough to any viable feedback.  If the warehousing was planning to maintain operations in its current location there would be areas where efficiencies could be created to both better the work environment, work/life benefits, and save the company money.

Wasn’t a good experience. I feel I waisted 10 years of my life. It is the union vs management and that is not a fun environment to be in. Everyday is a fight to keep your job and only the strong survive. Sounds crazy but it’s the truth!
Hours are not that good but for a first job it’s a okay start but not a place to make a career they don’t really work so well with Scheduling so Cautious

A typical day of work at the fuel station was a busy one. Many customers come in and out all day, and it is necessary to have excellent customer service to deal with customers. Fun co-workers made the job more appealing, but overall the job was very easy, but stressful dealing with so many people.

If your looking for a job that has kinda good pay and good benefits this may be for you. The management sucks but your in a union which can really help if anything happens. Raises happen every 6 months and they usually have good advancement opportunities

While working at Safeway the work was very easy and fun at the same time ,I washed dishes and collected dishes from my station.The most enjoyable part of my job was getting too go on break and walk the golf courses that’s what I loved doing most!

Usually just normal work day show up, help customers, prepare the food cases for lunch service, management was pretty much non existent, hardest part of the job was cleaning the fryers and making sure everything was perfect for the next day, sometimes it could feel tedious but most of the time the job was pretty enjoyable when i was out on the floor stalking shelf's.

It is a very nice place to work. I love my co workers and I am able to get a ton of stuff done since I am a reliable worker. I also get paid quite fairly. The management could use a little work, but overall it is a quite enjoyable place to work. It has given me tons of experience in different areas of the company as well.

As a courtesy clerk, it is very exhausting and sometimes feels mindless. While time off requests were sometimes followed, often there were mistakes in schedules, and I personally was scheduled after my last day was supposed to be. But the management people were all very sweet and are trying their best to make the employees happy
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Was only hired to cover for someone who went to jail and after said person returned I was fired three days after they returned. I was not told that I was going to be a replacement for a short period of time. They over work you and are over all very rude! Be careful.

Full of pr*cks, customers and employees alike.  Then you catch yourself slowly turning in to the pr*ck you hate, trying to appease the masses of a****les you're going to encounter.  You need this job, alright, don't work here unless you absolutely f****** have to.  They're going to milk you like a d*mn cow, except it's your life they're taking .

The job is really not as hard as the people who work there make it sound. But what Safeway's core values are about are somewhat corrupt and not what they make it out to be. They'll try and screw you over at any perfect opportunity.

I would have love to stay there but i have to pay the bills the cost of living not is high for me to pay by myself. The people is nice there you can get alot of things done if i get a high paying job i will be bless

What I have learned is the duties that needs to be done on your shift don’t depend on anyone because it won’t get done   Just do it yourself  and do not assume that the job was done always double check.
The moral is disheartening to say the least: but I absolutely adore my grandson and because of him; I will do the right thing ; even if Safeway does not care.

This is not a good company to work for so many people besides myself that wanted to move up in the company at first I was on top with one manager in the company and then it was switched real quick when a new one came in I was pushed down to the bottom and had to work super hard again and again to try and get up again but never look at
The work environment could be improved, most the equipment needs to be either fixed or replaced. Some of the other employees could stand to be questioned for

Many reviews for this company are positive.  These are all back office.  Working in a store is a horrible experience, even the union shop I worked in.  Bad wages, horrid corporporate policies.  Just don't.
Enjoyed working here for the most part. I liked who I worked with and also liked the managers. I was a part time employee so my hours where fine with me.
the worst company to work for
This was an okay place to work. Some of the management plays favorites. Some things were good and a lot were bad. Sometimes just thrown into the job without any feed back.
if flexibility and convenience is what youre looking for, this is the job for you. its close by and most department managers will work with your schedule you interview with.
This job helped me get on my feet when I moved , The culture was fun i work in three different stores and i had great relationships with all my co-workers,

My experience at Safeway has been overall a good one. I have worked at three different Safeways and it has only been at this last one that i am looking for a new job. I think that maybe the one i am currently at is just having some management problems.
I learned every position in the deli. Was topped out pay wise within 3 years. I really enjoyed my job there      the employees there are very nice and fun to work with

Fun working/interacting with different coworkers and learn who they are. Learning from who they are and how they lived life is an inspiration of who they are why they are. I like learning about different backgrounds because it helps you understand about diversity and what they faced in their lives.
Its a good job to know how things work around the store. I have learn what i need to know about  working with customers in any situation positive or negative.
The union protects you from being mistreated by management if you know your rights, so as long as you work hard and don't mess up over and over again you'll be fine.

I feel as though the workers are truly connected to the customers, addressing their needs and assisting in their daily shopping experience. However, the managers do not address the needs of the workers and listen to feedback or suggestions.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

It is better or worse depending on the location, but usually the hours are flexible and the work isn't hard. The better the management, the more effectively the floor is run. Also, the people you work with are usually really nice!

It was always very stressful. The people there - co-workers and customers, were amazing. I loved coming to work because of the people I got to work with. We got through each day with each other. I did learn a lot of my customer service and problem resolution skills here.Scheduling wasn't very efficient and management wasn't always the best either. The hardest part was being short staffed so much. For the employees that did come in to work, more pressure was added to us.
This was my 1st time working under the union. That made it that much better. I worked as a cashier for 2 months then promoted. Training was very thorough.
The Albertson's acquisition of the company changed the diversity and inclusion culture of Safeway. Also the customer focus has changed and employees don't seem to care as much as before.
Great place to work, really friendly culture and are always supportive of there employees on top this they are super inclusive of all kinds of backgrounds
I like working there it was very clean organized and labor union help with job desputes I never failec because manager was always involved I got good experience
No hours there are no hours at all you only get 23 maybe 25 hours per week no matter what managment is horrible even worse when it come to upper management visits and still again no hours available
The work was busy, and its customer service so multitasking/prioritizing was important. Management was problematic at some points but Union helped with clearing everything up

They have a computer lecture and test you must complete. It usually takes about 4-5 hours, but you get paid your normal wage for the hours spent on this assessment. You must keep calling them and be persistent with earning the job, they wont call you back to update you on the hiring process. The interview is fairly easy and simple, and afterwards you should keep calling to know your position. They will teach you anything you don’t already know from the computer assessment.

This company is the bottom of the bottom for professionalism and management.  Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere. I quit after 5 hours and I wrote a long letter to corporate regarding their appalling management.

If you like to ask everyone all the time if they need an immunization, this job is for you.  Staffing hours are based on sales not how many scripts you do.  We have days where we do close to 300 scripts and our sales are low, and we have days where we do 150 scripts and our sales are sky high.  I believe, this is a recipe for disaster, when you do 300 scripts with just a pharmacist and 3 techs.  Also, you are salaried, and it is expected that you will stay late and work for free
I loved this job i loved talking to the customers some of them I knew by name. I would of stayed they would always cut the deli hours and give them to grocery for no apperent reason.

If you're willing to work hard and communicate your aspirations this company has no limits for the things you can achieve. They promote from within and so long as you maintain a positive attitude and strive to learn everything you can while you're there you can quickly move up and go into several different career avenues whether it is department management, store management or even backstage careers.
Nice place to work, friendly customers. If you give a smile, get a smile back. Company is good. Just don't like how we don't have that much help in  the front end.

I was happy that I got an opportunity to work there but once the manager met me she was rude, disrespectful, and not helpful at all. I warn anyone if you want a job in bakery get ready to be treated awful by all the employees it's not a good place to work and the main manager sticks up for this person's behavior .Awful place to work for.
It's ok, not horrible. If you were a employee that wanted to move up and achieve this is not the place for you. But you are young and need some spending money then it's a good job.

It's a grocery store so everyone's like family.  Great management and coworkers.  Safeway is a very enjoyable and family oriented place to work.  Work can sometimes be overwhelming on holidays but staff is always there to back you up.
Safeway was very family friendly. I enjoyed building a rapport wit a lot of the returning customers. The employees/management were also very pleasant to work with there.

Do not recommend working this location.  Horrible management, benefits are a joke, pay is low even with prior experience. Customer service is out the door and the manager has a criminal record in California.

There are a multitude of departments to work for. Certain departments have excellent pay. Only draw back is depending on the state you live in the mandatory joining of the union is a little irritating but has its benefits as well.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Overall, the majority of the time I had a good time working for Safeway. They were very lenient, and the management kept a smile on their face. Although, it can become difficult being a new worker because you get the more busy days the more experienced employees would avoid.

Hard workers are not appreciated.  The wage is very low and one must belong to the Union and pay monthly dues. Scheduling occurs weekly and not always does one receive the minimum of 24 hours of work to maintain insurance coverage.
Slave way is another word to work Safeway.  The hours suck. They treat just like slaves.  The managers won't let you transfer to a different department.

When I first started as a barista, the hours were very flexible and everything was mostly about the customer. As a manager, my work seemed to take precedence (which I did expect in a way), but it felt that work was supposed to be my whole life. The most enjoyable part of the job though is the people (customers and who you work with). It makes the job a lot more fun.
its great cant speak for other.i which it did change managment it would have been last place i would have work.They also help you with personal problem you had your life to .

I really enjoyed working for Safeway great benefits and you can move up if you work hard they always mad sure I felt comfortable and let me kno that I was appreciated...would definitely work for them again.

It would be better if they gave hours to the people that need them and give college kids all the part time positions they can work, and give people with physical disabilities positions they can physically handle.
Safeway is in negotiations with the their union and company right now. If they cared about their employees Safeway would give them what they want: better pay, benefits, etc.
Myself love working at safeway ,help the custom bag the grocery for the custom in the store.putting item on  the shelve in the store.help the edely person in the store with the grorcery.

Follow the rules of being a nice person. Safeway is like a family. Amazing people. Loved the job. Lovedthe people. It's sometimes hard work depending on your department. Be on time. Be friends with your union rep. He's a great guy.... And you'll work there forever if that's your goal.
Would not recommend working for them unless you want to not have a family or never see you family. Good for workaholic people. Never considered other people only themselves.
They are only concerned about making money. Try to get the most work out of you without having to actually pay you the wages for the jobs you re doing.

they take advantage of the employes and no way to advance in the company. the company doesn't have any good qualities and needs to have a major restructure so that employees actually get some type of benefits.
It’s a good company to work for. I’m not getting paid as much and we don’t get overtime. The upper management are good people and they put us in a good position to succeed

When I had started, everything seemed fine. The people are usually a lot of fun to work with, however within a couple months the cracks are showing. Disrespectful managers, lazy courtesy clerks, and a few of the higher ups don't care about you at all. The pay is not worth the effort they expect out of you.
I worked as a stocker and cashier. I'm very friendly so Cashier was what i liked to do. not many hours to go around but gives you flexiblity to maybe work another job.

For the 4 years that I have worked under Safeway, my store has changed directors 11 times. That's a average of 3-4 months per store director before they quit or are fired. It should be no surprise that as a result the chain of command is completely unintelligible, often resulting in conflicting commands and denial of prior confirmed requests.
Did not enjoy this job. Not very organized and customers and staff is rude. Management could care less about employees and Union is no help yet you pay so much for it.
Many issues with False accusations. Not taking the right taxes out. Threatening D.M. false promises from all upper management.

This is the kind of job you want if you’re interested in climbing up in a company. I got my chance and it went great. Would have stayed if I had not been given a better opportunity elsewhere. But great experience with this company. Highly recommend.
It is a regular cashier experience. You have to provide a lot of customer service. You need to be able to stand for a long period of time but there are 15 minute breaks every two hours of work.

Learned interacting and working with customers and clients and co workers that taught me how to appreciate people that came to the store daily. Most enjoyable and hardest parts of the job. Busy job with a lot of standing and walking and carrying/picking up. Cleaned the spilt stuff and put caution etc.
My hard work never paid off, terrible management, no discounts, and overall they guaranteed me holiday pay and overtime but never revived either within the time I was employed.
Commit yourself too excellence and thrive too set a goal and hit the targets and stay positive and share and mentor your experience for the next ones that are looking too succeed.
welling to work good worker  love4 to work very hard realieable very hard worker please help good a good job please please help good worker honest worker hard

Management  is very understanding. Wonderful coworkers, but can tend to be a lot of drama. It tended to be very fast paced and hard labor at times. Hardest part of the job was standing my ground and refusing to be overworked, but I genuinely enjoyed my day to day work.

They are mostly focused on making money (hard to do with no hard working people) and will drive you into the ground if you’re not careful. They won’t try to help you out if you aren’t deathly ill, only good thing is the union
this Safeway location maintained a professional atmosphere with a comfortable environment that ensured peak performance for myself and other employees.
It was  an okay place to work. The job was okay, if I had to go back again I would if I had too.   It was an typical day of work at Safeway.  This job was very demanding.
definitely a place to where you can grow and gain better job opportunites. there are tons of people here to help you improve your knowledge on basic life skills.

Coming into work was a great feeling to assist customers  in their everyday shopping. When I was working for the deli department we worked at a fast pace to get customers in and out which was great service on our end.
I loved it, then I hated it and the culture. Overall its ok. I loved some of my co workers other I tolerated because I had to. Again I hated this job but i liked it because of my co workers.
Working for Safeway we were never slow and always got all the tasks we were given done in a timely manner even when the store was packed. Customers and employees always left happy and satisfied.

Had to leave because it was impossible to get to work after I had to move I wish that I could still work for the company but I belive that time has past I do not blame them it is a great company to work for

Safeway has many different opportunities no matter who you are and I think that is very important in a workplace. There are rarely any times you would walk into a Safeway and there is one person not working hard.

At work I usually get along with my fellow employees. responsibilities include Cleaning regularly, Handling money. Assisting customers find items in the store. etc. the hardest part of the job is just the rude customers.
While working for Safeway i had many opportunities to improve my work skills and i enjoyed my time there, just had hoped they would have more flexibility on hours
Safeway is a decent place to work. Base pay unless you decide you want to move up further into management. Personable people and job. Constant learning and review of how to improve.

On your feet job, physically demanding and a continuously busy schedule! Big team of workers you were always being introduced, good job for someone who works better on a busier schedule, likes to be physically active for long periods of time, and works well in customer service.
its a productive work place but the management is terrible. I was getting yelled at by management for doing something they told me to do, exactly as they told me to do it.

I worked at Safeway from 2018-2020 as a Jamba Juice Clerk. It was pretty good overall. We got free smoothies on the shift, management was not breathing down my neck, and I knew my job inside out because I used to work at a stand alone Jamba. However, this Jamba Juice is now more Safeway-oriented because we never  meaning we no longer accepted any sort of Jamba gift card/promotional item. Also, the Jamba shirt I wore was from about 3 years back because we couldn't order anymore.
